boardgame.name: Vale of Shadows
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

‘Vale of Shadow’ is a quick-adventure for a party of four 2nd level characters. Very little adaptation should be necessary to use in any campaign setting.

Adventure Background
An ancient amulet carries the last remaining ghostly spirit of a terrible necromancer. How it came into the possession of this young woman, is unknown, but the effect it has had is obvious. Seemingly possessed, the woman broke free from her village and attacked anyone who dared to stop her as she ran into the woods. An elderly person in the village recounts a dark tale about an evil man who once raised the spirits of the dead as deadly shadows and spirits to terrorize the living. They are certain they saw that amulet in their youth. They beg the party to save the young girl, and stop that amulet from getting to where, long ago, that necromancer was buried.

boardgame.name: Ettin's Lair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #59: Ettin's Lair provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the ettin lairs in your campaign.

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Adventure Module H1: Hard Ticket to Lud
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SIX DAYS AND SEVEN NIGHTS THROUGH THE MARSH

Lud is a people and a village, sun-baked and reed-clad, nomadic boat-dwellers that drift through the marshes in the manner of their ancestors. They are known for:

The Wandering Urth: The urth does not rest easy here; it moves, and shifts, and sometimes bubbles up out from the muck to drift and float into the summer sky. The Satraps of the north call them levistones and use them to power their skyships.
The Cyclopean Ruins: In the Long-Ago, this was not a marsh but a rugged mountain, ruled by a fierce people of stone with singular, burning eyes. The remains of their Empire lie scattered about the marsh, in places called taboo by the Luds.
The Only Safe Path To Qud: Qud, that carnelian city of gleaming spires and roaring crowds, souqs packed and teeming with lings and treasure from across the Million-Million Spheres, lies across the marsh. It is a place where fortunes can be won and lost - but you have to get there, first…


The Luds (page 8) are a people divided; many are content to live in the nomadic manner of their ancestors, though some long for the trappings and trinkets of the World Outside. This divide has left them easy prey for the Satrap.

The Cyclopeans (page 12) are not dead; merely slumbering deep beneath the urth following the collapse of their galactic civilization. Yoked to the geas that binds them to the Crown of Command, its siren song has roused them from slumber.

Tanith (page 9), a lowly laborer for the Satrap, pulled the Crown of Command from a levistone dig site in northeastern Lud. Since then he has been on the run, pursued by cyclopean terrors by day and a burning, unblinking eye of flame by night…

This is a 40-page introductory hexcrawl adventure for UNCONQUERED (or other old-school role-playing games) and is suitable for 4-8 characters of 1st-level. It can serve as a stand-alone adventure session or as the basis for a larger campaign.

boardgame.name: Memento Mori: Vaetia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A scholars book. This vault of knowledge serves to describe the lands of Vaetia. It contains tips of running a Memento Mori game, as well as alterations and new monsters, and the full corruption system.

[This] details the campaign setting of Memento Mori. Inspired by Victorian Gothic, Steampunk, Sword and Sorcery, Dark Fantasy, and Horror the Memento Mori setting breaks the fantasy mold.

Vaetia contains rulesets, mechanics, and needed information to run a campaign in the land of Devara.

boardgame.name: Creature Companions: A New Option For Any Class
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Sometimes, a family is a hardened warrior, a grizzled old wizard, a strangely talkative monk, a stocky knowledge seeker, and their dancing beetle covered in assorted fungi.”
— Qwinston Mayhill, knowledge seeker

A slimeling slithers from beneath a now unlocked door and accepts a scrap of meat from their dungeoneering keeper. A bard sings in the town square while his pygmy owlbear toddles through the crowd accepting coins. A brawler lifts her domidan high into the air so it can see the next match in the crowded arena.

Over the course of their travels, adventurers cross paths with the most dangerous creatures in the realms, often surviving gnashing teeth, magical attacks, and feral ambushes by margins thin enough to see through. But it takes a special kind of individual to face the monsters of the world and not blink. And an even more special one to reach out and give them a pet afterward.

New Friends, New Rules
The following new game option introduces rules that would allow anyone to link themselves to a creature companion, something typically reserved for druids, rangers, and wizards. Although some tables will find this to be an excellent way to expand their games and open up new roleplay opportunities for their table, some players and GMs may find the introduction of additional companions cumbersome to their style of gameplay.

As with all new rules and game options, it is highly recommended that the addition of creature companion options into your game be discussed during your pre-campaign conversations or during your group’s session zero, specifically how players and GMs will handle the danger and mortality that accompanies adventuring with a living creature and how that creature will be handled mechanically throughout the course of their gameplay.

This supplement includes:

The complete system for any class to link with a creature companion!
The 5 stages of unique benefits that each creature companion provides.
12 creature companions to link with, including:
Cat
Black Bear
Domidan
Elk
Holderkin
Noggle's Beetle
Pygmy Owlbear
Slimeling
Warhorse
Wolf
Wyrm Toad
Zephyr
4 link empowering feats to take your bond and your creature companion to new heights!
3 spells provided by your mystic link.
7 new stat blocks for the creature companions provided.

boardgame.name: Game of Gnomes
boardgame.description:
Be the first to grab the correct gnome!

A round begins by one player rolling the three dice. Each die represents either a shirt colour, a garden tool or a stylish accessory. Using the provided grabbers, players try and be the first to grab the gnome that matches all three categories rolled.

The first player to grab the correct matching gnome wins the round. Be the first player to grab 5 gnomes and win the game!

boardgame.name: Alternate Magic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

ALTERNATE MAGIC is a collection of mechanics for old school and OSR systems.
If you like "Basic" games and its clones (Old School Essentials, Basic Fantasy RPG, Labyrinth Lord, etc.), or even other OSR games, and want to expand magic options, you'll certainly enjoy this one!
This book is compatible with Dark Fantasy Basic, including a specific chapter on conversions. Some ideas can serve as inspiration for any RPG system, but we assume you're familiar with old school or OSR games.
In these pages, you'll find:
- New spellcasting classes;
- Flexible spells, suited for any spell level.
- Blood magic, random magic, and spell points.
- Cantrips and rituals.
- Alternatives for the cleric class
- ...and many other tools.
The book is entirely modular! Each chapter can be used by itself or in combination with other chapters. For example, you might use blood magic with the traditional spellcasting system or combine it with flexible magic. You can use random magic with spell points or cantrips, or by itself. You might use the new classes without changing anything else in your game.

boardgame.name: Cyber Seeds: Collection 05
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oy, budzo! Are you running a game of Cyberpunk, Shadowrun, Carbon 2185, The Sprawl, or something similar? Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Cyber Seed.

DRP Cyber Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Black market trader Rudik sold a super-fast jackport to your friend, who had it embedded at the base of her skull. Now Rudik and his corporate client want it back.
A special long range rifle and its ammo are stored in a vault at an abandoned prison. Do you help Tuffin the merc retrieve it, without getting his family killed?

boardgame.name: V Rising
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





A VAMPIRE SURVIVAL EXPERIENCE
BUILD your castle, HUNT for blood, and RISE in power. Conquer the world of the living in a gothic Multiplayer Survival Game.

Awaken as a weakened vampire after centuries of slumber. Hunt for blood in nearby settlements to regain your strength while hiding from the scorching sun to survive.

Explore a vast open-world together with friends or hunt solo as you pillage villages, raid bandit camps, and traverse the territories of supernatural beasts. Rebuild your castle and convert humans into loyal servants in a quest to raise your vampire empire. Make allies online and wage war against other players in a world of conflict.

Will you become the next Dracula?

RISE FROM YOUR GRAVE
Awaken as a weakened Vampire after centuries of slumber in a world full of danger. Stripped from your unholy powers and starving for blood - you must hunt to regain your strength and fight for survival.

FEAR THE LIGHT
Lurk in the shadows in the daytime or risk getting burned to ashes by the sunlight. Stalk the night and prey on your victims in the dark. As a vampire, you must quench your thirst for blood while planning your strategies around the day and nighttime.

RULE THE NIGHT
Unleash your powers after dusk and stalk your victims in the dark. Explore an open world together with friends or hunt solo as you pillage villages, raid bandits, and delve into the territories of supernatural beasts.

A WORLD IN CONFLICT
Tailor your vampire to fit your play style by combining weapons with a variety of spells earned through vanquishing powerful foes. Raid other players’ castles or become a diplomat in the game of blood, power, and betrayal. Compete or cooperate - the choice is yours.

BUILD YOUR CASTLE
Construct your castle and exhibit your vampiric style. Fill your halls with lavish decor, become the envy of your undead peers, and oversee your domain of darkness from atop your regal throne.

COMMAND YOUR SERVANTS
Lure victims back to your castle and convert them into your undead minions. Your loyal servants will lay down their lives in defense of your manor, or send them out to gather precious materials so you don’t have to dirty your hands.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Sherlock Holmes: Der Tod des Hutmachers
boardgame.description:
Escape Card Game for up to 4 players

London, 1891.
The highly respected hatter Mr. Kenworthy is found dead. His store shows no signs of burglary, his body no sign of violence. What happened and who is behind the crime?

In this exciting Escape Room game you slip into the role of master detective Sherlock Holmes to solve the case of the dead hatter. Only if you show a sharp mind, ingenuity and a gift for deduction, you can find the murderer and solve the ominous background of this crime.

—description from the publisher (translated)

London, 1891.
Der hoch angesehene Hutmacher Mr. Kenworthy wird tot aufgefunden. Sein Laden zeigt keine Einbruchsspuren, seine Leiche keinerlei Gewalteinwirkung. Was ist passiert und wer steckt hinter der Tat?

In diesem spannenden Escape-Room-Spiel schlüpft ihr in die Rolle von Meisterdetektiv Sherlock Holmes, um den Fall des toten Hutmachers zu lösen. Nur wenn ihr einen scharfen Verstand, Einfallsreichtum und Kombinationsgabe beweist, könnt ihr den Mörder Stellen und die ominösen Hintergründe dieses Verbrechens aufklären.

—description from the publisher (German)

boardgame.name: Into The Echoside: The Shaggy Show
boardgame.description:
A single promotional card only available from the Dark Carnival Games Con in 2018.

From the card's announcement on Facebook: "IT’S SHAGGGGYYY TIMMMMEEE! World Premiere: We present to you: THE SHAGGY SHOW promo card!!! DCG Con, May 11-13th, in Denver, is the ONLY place you can cop the Oracle of the Three Rings expansion for Into the Echoside, featuring the exclusive Shaggy Show Promo Card! You’ll get this exclusive card FREE with your purchase of Oracle…ONLY at the Con. Only at the DCG Con. For Juggalos, By Juggalos!"

boardgame.name: Into The Echoside: Promo Card Set
boardgame.description:
A set of three promotional cards, one from each faction, for Into The Echoside. They were all included in a single pack available for those who preordered Into The Echoside: Oracle of the Three Rings.

The three cards were Inner City Posse, Wizard of the Hood, and Blahzay Rose.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Into the Echoside: Oracle of the Three Rings

boardgame.name: Wreckland Run: Card Sleeves
boardgame.description: 225 Card Sleeves in 3 designs Size: 45x68mm

boardgame.name: Corruptia: Segunda Vuelta
boardgame.description:
From the designers of Corruptia, came a new game for 2 players!

Welcome to Corruptia: Second Round, an asymmetrical card game where a business man and a candidate try to obtain the major quantity of personal benefits during the second round of the presidential elections.

As the benefactor, you will try to buy the presidential candidate offering different agendas for your economical convenience in exchange to finance their campaign.

As the candidate, you will try to gain resources for your campaign taken economic agendas that doesn´t affect you too much on your personal reputation with your voters.

After 8 turns of negotiations, the player who obtain the major benefits will win the game.

Any resemblance with reality is only coincidence...

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Connect37
boardgame.description:
In Connect37, players are placing tiles, numbered 1 to 37 into a hexagonal grid. When they place a tile, they may also place one of their chips onto it.

At the end of the game, players check for groups of tiles on the board with consecutive numbers, such that you can trace a sequential path; any player chips on these tiles are worth points.

The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Escape Game Verschollen im Bermuda Dreieck
boardgame.description:
You are stranded on a remote island in the middle of the Bermuda Triangle where strange experiments seem to be taking place... Solve the mysteries you come across! Find out what's going on on the island! And fight the dangerous secret organisation ARES to escape from there!

Contents: - Adventure cards to explore the island and solve the puzzles! - Door lock code cards to gain access anywhere! - Encrypted records to uncover the secrets of the island!

Ihr seid auf einer abgelegenen Insel mitten im Bermuda-Dreieck gestrandet, auf der offenbar seltsame Experimente stattfinden … Löst die Rätsel, auf die ihr stoßt! Findet heraus, was auf der Insel vor sich geht! Und kämpft gegen die gefährliche Geheimorganisation ARES, um von dort zu entkommen!

Inhalt: - Abenteuer-Karten zum Erkunden der Insel und zum Lösen der Rätsel! - Türschloss-Code-Karten, die euch überall Zugang verschaffen! - Verschlüsselte Aufzeichnungen, mit denen ihr die Geheimnisse der Insel aufdeckt!

boardgame.name: Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Altered Fates
boardgame.description:
Lady Helena, the woman who hired you, is abducted through a polychromatic portal before your eyes! With the portal closing and only moments to act, you must decide who will follow into the unknown. Will you be able to work together even while torn apart?

Altered Fates challenges investigators like never before by dividing the team across two maps that are in play simultaneously. The first is a proper 1920s mansion, like those you have come across in previous investigations. The second, however, is the future of this home— now an abandoned, boarded-up building. Each map presents its own series of challenges, with the investigators in the present directly affecting the investigation of their companions in the future: an item tucked beneath a loose floorboard may be found later in the same hiding place, or a rescued captive may be able to return to the mansion in the future.

boardgame.name: Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – What Lies Withing
boardgame.description:
A murder in Southside leaves a home abandoned–except for the strange noises coming from the cellar…

What Lies Within is a scenario for 1-5 investigators in which a murder is only the beginning of the inexplicable occurrences in one Arkham mansion. Investigators will explore a murder scene, fend off terrible creatures, encounter strange phenomena, and investigate the noises coming from the cellar of the supposedly empty house. They must discover why the victim was murdered–and what he did with his life before it was so violently ended–in order to leave the mansion alive.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mansions of Madness: Second Edition – Dark Reflections
boardgame.description:
An isolated country estate’s secrets come to light when a woman inexplicably vanishes from its rooms!

Dark Reflections is a scenario for 1-5 investigators in which the disappearance of Ada Miller ignites a series of events that warps the nature of reality. Investigators will travel to a crumbling country manor in search of Ada’s ultimate fate. Inside, they must decipher what Ada left behind and withstand a variety of strange and frightening events as the walls separating their reality from another begin to collapse.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Who Wants To Be A Billionaire
boardgame.description:
Explore the world of tech from your tabletop! Build a 1-billion-dollar startup (a unicorn), and along the way, discover 70+ modern strategies and 15+ career fields in STEM and Liberal Arts, recognizing how the greatest technology companies have become successful!

Brief overview of how the game is played:

To start, players roll two eight-sided dice to go around the board and hire people, then acquire technologies. After that, players are eligible to launch products and features upon which they get users, which increases the valuation of their start-up. The players pick action cards along the way that gives them a glimpse into the workings of Artificial Intelligence, Digital Marketing, Cloud Computing and Cybersecurity, in a fun way while continuing to build their startup.

The first player whose startup becomes a unicorn, by reaching a $1 billion valuation, wins. Other players race on for the next spot.

boardgame.name: Battlestar Galactica: The Board Game – BoardGameBoost Character Stands
boardgame.description:
These Character Stands hold the cardboard tokens and help these unique personalities stand out on the game board!

Battlestar Galactica, both the board game and the show, is full of space battles, advanced technology, ration management and more, but in the end it really comes down to the characters on the ship... and which of them can be trusted. This set of Character Stands adds some polish to this great gaming experience.

This set includes acrylic Character Stands that hold the cardboard character tokens from the game, and don't damage the tokens like the stands that come with the game do. These stands have a pop-top that allows the tokens to be easily swapped in and out for each playing, based on the characters selected for that game. In addition, this set comes with title rings that can be easily slid on and off of the character stands to denote important roles such as Admiral, President, CAG and more. Lastly, this set includes three Nuke tokens to replace those that come with the game to add a bit more significance to this major game element.

This Battlestar Galactica Character Stand set comes with:
• 7 total character stands: 6 blue and 1 red (if playing with Cylon leader) - enough for the max # of players with expansions
• 2 Cylon stand rings
• 1 Sympathizer stand ring
• 1 Admiral stand ring
• 1 President stand ring
• 1 CAG stand ring
• 1 CAG pilot token holder
• 1 Mutineer stand ring
• 3 Nuke tokens

Assembly needs no glue but does require steady hands and careful attention to the video instructions. Assembly by an adult or with adult supervision is strongly recommended.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Battlestar Galactica: The Board Game – Daybreak Expansion
Battlestar Galactica: The Board Game – Exodus Expansion
Battlestar Galactica: The Board Game – Pegasus Expansion

boardgame.name: Hey! That's Not'chyo Nacho!
boardgame.description:
In Not'chyo Nacho! you are hungry and eager to gobble up your NACHOS! Only there's a problem - the nacho toppings are all mixed up and you want your nachos your way!

You'll have to trade chips with other players (eaters) to match all the toppings on your nachos.

Be careful not to miss one in your haste that is NOT'CHYO NACHO! because you must lay down all 7 of your matching NACHOS first, to win!

Players play simultaneously, in a frenzied atmosphere as they all seek to get a handful of matching NACHOS.

You'll need to get loud and even a little pushy if you've any hope of getting all your NACHOS first!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Castles of Burgundy: Special Edition
boardgame.description:
Castles of Burgundy is a legendary Board Game design created by Stefan Feld. In this 1-4 players tabletop experience, you will take on the role of an aristocrat controlling a small princedom. Trying to build a settlement with powerful castles, practice trades, exploit silver mines, and use the knowledge of travelers.
Now, this timeless game is coming back with an extremely polished, high-end special edition resulting from a collaboration between Ravensburger and Awaken Realms.

In this special edition, you can expect a complete re-design of art and layout to ensure that every piece will have great art and enhance in-game usability. Only the best materials (cardboard, cart paper, box, insert, etc.) will be used to provide endurance, and a premium feel. Many extra components will bring the gaming experience to the next level, such as double-layered player boards, special bags for hexes, 30% bigger tiles, or metal coins.

The Castles of Burgundy is set in the Burgundy region of High Medieval France. Each player takes on the role of an aristocrat, originally controlling a small princedom. While playing, they aim to build settlements and powerful castles, practice trade along the river, exploit silver mines, and use the knowledge of travelers.

The game is about players taking settlement tiles from the game board and placing them into their princedom, which is represented by a Duchy board that is placed in the Player board.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Castles Of Burgundy: Special Edition – Playmat
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: New PREORDER Special edition (gameplay all in) + 3D terrain tiles
New PREORDER SUNDROP Majestic pledge (all in)

boardgame.name: The Tavern from Hell
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The Tavern from Hell is a Labyrinth Lord adventure for 4 to 6 characters of 1st to 3rd level.

A local tavern, known as a hive of scum and villainy, has fallen under the powerful curse of an angry wizard. The locals and the heirs of the taverner are offering an exorbitant sum for adventurers to go in and perform the needful actions to lift the curse.

It is a LOT of money. And the adventurers get to keep all the treasure they find in the tavern. And the local authorities have even suspended their usual taxes on treasure.

Too good to be true?

As a down-on-your-luck adventurer, you are probably too poor to care…

Designed for use with Labyrinth Lord, easily adaptable to any Old School RPG system.

16 pages, 12 pages of ADVENTURE!

boardgame.name: Latin American Monsters (PF2)
boardgame.description:
Latin American Monsters brings you incredible creatures from Central and South America and the Caribbean, from ahuizotl to zuvembie! You'll find divine messengers and protectors like the magui and xiuh couatl alongside sinister fiends like the soucouyant and xipe totec the Flayed Lord, living fey like the curupira and encantado alongside deathless terrors like the llorona and tzitzimitl, living engines of destruction like the lusca and chupacabra and unliving constructs like the cuauhxicalli and xolo guardian. Guardians of the wild like the tunche and madremonte stand beside fantastic versions of real-world creatures like the anaconda, giant iguana, black caiman, jaguar, and giant mantis shrimp!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Fateforge: Chronicles of Kaan
boardgame.description:
In this city that he has made into the pride of all Kaan, the Ilkral has eyes and ears at every corner. He is a beloved ruler, but in the shadows of this city he has buried dark secrets. There is an ambition in him that will not rest until all of Kaan has bent the knee to him, and I fear he will burn our homeland to ash and scatter it on the winds if it stands in his way.

Fateforge: Chronicles of Kaan is a cooperative, campaign adventure for 1 to 4 players with a quick setup and learn-as-you-go rules that can be played in sessions of as little as 30 minutes!

You will take on the role of heroes venturing out of their forested homeland to the crowded, opulent city of Easafir with the hope of freeing an emissary locked up in the Emperor’s palace. Along the way, you will meet a cast of dubious characters and get dragged into thorny situations that will require a charming turn of phrase or an arrow to the head to resolve. This app-driven narrative adventure adapts to your choices, successes and failures. Each of these choices weaves a different path through the game’s sprawling story-branches for a truly unique experience with each playthrough.

Fateforge: Chronicles of Kaan is a cooperative game that offers a fresh take on the dungeon crawler genre. We’re calling it a dungeon brawler to emphasize the action-packed combat scenes where a lot happens in each round and every fight lasts around 30 minutes. The quick set up times and condensed combat scenes mean that you will experience multiple story beats and fights within a single session. The base rules are easy to pick-up with new elements added as you progress through the campaign.

The game is set in Kaan, a region of the fantasy world of Eana created by Studio Agate. Inspired by the richness and depth of the world and the gorgeous art that brought it to life, we applied our experience in board game development to create a unique immersive experience we hope you will all enjoy!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

boardgame.name: Ogre Mage's Lair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #60: Ogre Mage's Lair provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the ogre mage lairs in your campaign.

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Slum Dressing
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the slums in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Black Hole
boardgame.description:
An abstract game of losing meteors, the aptly if generically named game of Black Hole revolves around setting your asteroids on paths that will have them ricochet off other asteroids, straight into the pocket in the center.

Every turn you get to move one of your pieces in a straight line orthagonically - like a giant space rook. If they strike another of your pieces, that piece gets hurled to either side in a straight line. Pieces that cross the black hole in the center get removed from play - first to remove four pieces in this way wins the game.

boardgame.name: Weed Demon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Famous last words from the wasteland...

“Wait, did that little hill there just move? Let’s check it out.”

“Um, guys. Was that weed patch there when we entered this street before? And… are those skulls underneath it? Let’s look for loot.”

“This junk storm is just gonna get worse. C’mon, boys, let’s take shelter in that mound over there. Yes, the one with all those trees growing on it.”

“Whatchea worrying ‘bout? They’re just green walkers. We’ve mowed our way through a swarm of them before. C’mon, sissy, pull out your axe and let’s do this.”

“I wonder why them skullocks circled way around that clump of trees up there. You’d think they would’ve used it to take cover from Joe’s marksmanship. C’mon, let’s camp there tonight and continue tracking the pesky buggers in the morning.”

In an era where the plants will try to eat you, these nightmarish mutant growths take it a step further and will also absorb their still living human prey. The weed demon can appear in three terrifying forms: the young, green walker-like ‘stalker’, the multi-legged giant ‘trunker’, and finally, their ultimate tree bristling adult form as the ‘mounder’. Each age variety is equipped with the same toxin tipped stabbing limbs and ravenous need for the minerals, liquids and bones of their favoured humanoid prey.
The weed demon is our 19th Monday Mutant offering for The Mutant Epoch (TME) Tabletop RPG. This supplement includes stats and art for three size variants of this new, highly aggressive mutant plant; the stalker, the trunker and the massive, hill-like mounder. Within these fierce, fast moving hunters are the remains of past human victims, along with their stuff. We’ve included a massive 1d100 random loot table with this new creature, which offers a wide range of junk, curiosities and treasure that’s tangled within the bone fused roots of these damn things.

boardgame.name: Speak with Animals: Animal Companions I (PF2E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Speak with Animals: Animal Companions I adds 12 new animal stat blocks with added rules for using them as companions for Pathfinder Second Edition including the dire corgi, giant hamster, fossa and hyaenodon.

boardgame.name: The God Wheel
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An 5E location for 2nd- to 3rd-level characters

Village legends tell of a gargantuan stone wheel lodged in the earth. In your journeys, you’ve discovered the old tales are true, and the god wheel exists.

boardgame.name: Engine Trouble
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure for use with Cepheus Engine.

Jump travel in the frontiers of space is not an exact science. Errors sometimes do occur in space travel. Once in a while a misjump may take a ship way off course. On even rarer occasions, however, it might take them to another galaxy entirely. Such things are extremely rare but those are the risks of space travel.

When such navigational problems occur it becomes a struggle for life and death just to get home again.

boardgame.name: Shu's Tactics
boardgame.description:
Zhang Jue, together with his siblings Zhang Liang and Zhang Bao, has declared the beginning of the Yellow Turban rebellion, wreaking havoc on cities and villages across China. Liu Bei, a young man who can’t stand seeing innocent people being harmed by the war, has sworn brotherhood with Guan Yu and Zhang Fei, and is now planning to build up an army to help the government quell the rebellion. The three men have requested assistance from wealthy individuals in town, and you have decided to aid them knowing their great potential and heroic personalities. Now go ahead and join force with the brothers to become a part in the history of the Shu nation.

Shu’s Tactics is a solo campaign roll-and-write game in which the player builds military tactics to reclaim cities and lands from the Yellow Turban rebellious army. During the game, you will train your army, craft items, draw up schemes, and recruit legendary heroes to extinguish the rebellion. The player will play through a set of chapters to complete the story of the Shu Han nation.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Theme: Romance of the Three Kingdoms

boardgame.name: World of Avlis: Order of The Blue Flowers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a small village in the Protectorate of Blandenberg, news arrives that contact with the nearby abbey has been lost. The abbey of The Order of The Blue Flowers houses some strange inhabitants, and they are currently under attack by a force of magical constructs whose makers accuse the abbey monks of being undead abominations.

The party that takes up this task must find out who is attacking the inhabitants of the abbey and decide how to address the conflict. Are the attackers justified in their aggression? Are the monks really undead? Is something more mysterious than a simple undead infestation at play here?

Three to five characters of third level are optimal for this one-off adventure.

boardgame.name: The Trees Are Awake
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The heroes are approached by a mysterious stranger who offers them a princely sum in exchange for invading the magical laboratory below Holdwood Manor, a local property of the Green Order of the Forest, and destroying the results of the wizards’ magical research. To succeed, the heroes must successfully infiltrate the Manor’s grounds, find the entrance to the laboratory, and then deal with what’s inside.

Three to five characters of third level are optimal for this one-off adventure.

This is a 5th Edition D&D adventure set in The World of Avlis campaign setting, but may be used as a drop-in for any fantasy medieval campaign setting.

boardgame.name: Escape from New York
boardgame.description:
Escape from New York is a semi-cooperative game in which 1 to 4 players must infiltrate in the most dangerous prison of the world, trying to find the president and escape before is too late. You will face many bands of prisoners trying to stop you in every way, ruled by the deadliest boss on New York.

You will try to cooperate to find the President, the Tape escaping from a Bridge or do you will betray other heroes escaping from New York alone satisfying your secret objectives?

boardgame.name: Shadow of the Necromancer (1E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fear stalks through the darkness of night in the form of the walking dead! They attack innocent travelers and merchant caravans in the moonlight! Animated skeletons have also been seen digging up the recently dead and carrying them into the nearby ruins of an old abandoned keep! Rumor spreads fast from lip to ear amongst the locals, whispering that a sinister hooded figure has been seen directing the undead and is taking up residence in that foul dungeon! Your stalwart group of adventurers has decided to take on this challenge, get the treasure you know is in there and defeat this evil menace known only as the Shadow of the Necromancer!

Maximum Mayhem Dungeons “Mini Adventures” are designed for play within one or two gaming sessions! This module has that classic look and feel, including old school maps, removable covers and fantasy art from some of the best artists in the business! Filled with diabolical villains, irreverent characters, over-the-top monster encounters, outrageous magic, mischievous NPCs, traps, puzzles and more, this adventure will entertain and challenge everyone who dares to play it!

This module is designed for using 4-8 characters of levels 1 to 3. The party should consist of Fighters, Clerics, Magic Users, and a couple of Thieves, but you are free to figure out what works best for you and your group.

• 3 Full Color Maps and 3 Blue Maps
• 8 Pre-Generated Characters Levels 1-4
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Shadow of the Necromancer (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fear stalks through the darkness of night in the form of the walking dead! They attack innocent travelers and merchant caravans in the moonlight! Animated skeletons have also been seen digging up the recently dead and carrying them into the nearby ruins of an old abandoned keep! Rumor spreads fast from lip to ear amongst the locals, whispering that a sinister hooded figure has been seen directing the undead and is taking up residence in that foul dungeon! Your stalwart group of adventurers has decided to take on this challenge, get the treasure you know is in there and defeat this evil menace known only as the Shadow of the Necromancer!

Maximum Mayhem Dungeons “Mini Adventures” are designed for play within one or two gaming sessions! This module has that classic look and feel, including old school maps, removable covers and fantasy art from some of the best artists in the business! Filled with diabolical villains, irreverent characters, over-the-top monster encounters, outrageous magic, mischievous NPCs, traps, puzzles and more, this adventure will entertain and challenge everyone who dares to play it!

This module is designed for using 4-8 characters of levels 1 to 3. The party should consist of Fighters, Clerics, Magic Users, and a couple of Thieves, but you are free to figure out what works best for you and your group.

• 3 Full Color Maps and 3 Blue Maps
• 8 Pre-Generated Characters Levels 1-4

boardgame.name: Treasury of the City (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic of Sewer, Street, and Throne!

The city is a dangerous place, and adventurers daring to brave the urban jungle need the right equipment! Treasury of the City brings you three dozen brand-new Pathfinder Second Edition magic items perfect for every part of the city, from the back alleys, sewers, and slums, to the halls of power and the smoke-filled back rooms where power brokers rule from the shadows. You’ll find weapons and combat accessories like the toxic scabbard and forgetful sap alongside protective devices like cryptwarden’s plate and the roofrunner’s buckler. Delvers into the dank byways beneath the city will love ratty robes and the sewer suit, while those accustomed to high places will love the senator’s stole and the scale of endless bureaucracy! Criminals will find handy devices like pilferer’s gloves and the cheater’s hat, while officers of the law wield the mark of authority, nightwatch crossbow, and the inspector’s bullhorn to bring them to justice! Wherever your heroes venture in adventures of urban intrigue, they’ll find the perfect tools to take down treacherous advisers and bring justice to the streets.

boardgame.name: Le Corbeau et le Renard
boardgame.description:
The game theme refers to a tale by La Fontaine: The craw and the fox.
One player gets the fox, the other one the craws placing 5 of his 10 craws on the tree spaces on the first line of the board. The fox player cannot see if a craw has a cheese in its mouth or not. In his turn, the craw player has 5 action points. He may use for each craw at most 1 point. There are 3 possible actions: entering new craws at the base line, advance a craw to a tree of the next line, eating a cheese for as many victory points as the number of the line. This craw is out of the game now.
The fox player may move his fox one space within the fox net. All these spaces are connected with 1 to 4 trees. He may ask a craw on a connected tree to sing. If the craw has a cheese, it is out of the game, if not, it will continue. After all craws are out of the game, the roles change. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Iron Helm: Iron Chest
boardgame.description:
Iron Chest is the largest, and the final, expansion for Iron Helm and it packs a punch in terms of content. You will need the base game of Iron Helm to use this expansion. So what is in the box?

The Spire of Zogar This is the final Adventure Pack for Iron Helm and pits you against the evil tyrant Zogar himself! It consists of 18 cards including new loot, plot, and enemy cards, and a new boss, Zogar himself!

The Lonely Troll Inn This 18 card pack unlocks the ability to hire henchmen before you set off on an adventure. Simply pay some gold and they will tag along. Each one will provide different perks and each will have unique ways that their morale will drop. If they lose all their morale, they will leave, unless you pay them some more money. The provided 12mm die is used to track your henchmen's morale. This pack also includes a bunch of new trappings to equip your hero with!

Beasts & Burdens This 18 card pack introduces Afflictions! These nasty cards are gained in a number of ways and will cause the mechanics for play to change. Maybe you will suffer from gluttony and need to eat twice as much in between dungeon levels, or perhaps, you become plagued and start gaining poison at an alarming rate! This pack also includes a bunch of unique, and stronger, enemies to deal with and three mini-bosses that are actually plot cards!

Realms & Relics So you want more powerful items in Iron Helm? Now you get them! Artifacts are powerful relics that you can gain by spending blessing tokens when you are asked to draw a loot card. Spend the required blessing tokens and draw an artifact card instead! That is only half of this pack. It also introduces environment cards. These are drawn at the beginning of each dungeon level and they change the mechanics for that level. Maybe you are on the Shadow level and you are ambushed whenever an ambush card is drawn, even if it is the first card drawn! Or maybe you are in the Parched and all fire creatures are stronger.

Random Encounters This includes four double-sided jumbo map cards to track what level of the dungeon you are on. Also included are three minis (Male Ranger, Female Warrior, and Male Wizard) to use to track your position. Random Encounters adds a new mechanic where your hero encounters something in between each level of the dungeon. Symbols on the map cards indicate what the player will run into. Maybe Bolda trap, or some mushrooms, or a nasty foe lurking in the shadows...

Card Dividers This is not the sexiest addition, but these new dividers will keep your copy of Iron Helm nice and organized and sometimes order is sexy...

boardgame.name: Flying Colors
boardgame.description:
An abstract game of spreading coloured chips around, Flying Colors is a game for 2 or 3 people.

Piles of chips get moved around the hexagonal grid, with each player trying to make bits of three adjacent discs of the same colour for points.

boardgame.name: How to Lose a Guy in One DM
boardgame.description: Similar to your everyday life, swipe right (pick up) the profile that you like, read their bio, receive an inappropriate DM, and choose the best response you have from your hand. One person selects the best DM! Play as many rounds as you want. The player that wins the most rounds by the end wins the whole game!

boardgame.name: Madera contra Acero: La Conquista de Canarias
boardgame.description:
Masqueoca NAC wargames in its project to promote games with a national theme has been kind enough to include in its programme one with a hitherto unpublished and original theme, and as a Canarian designer it is a great satisfaction for me to present it. Wood against Steel, The Conquest of the Canary Islands. Already the title gives us a small clue of the inequality in weaponry on the sides involved in this war. The wooden and stone weapons of the Guanches against the iron and steel of the conquerors of the Crown of Castile. But make no mistake, even though it was a very unequal struggle, the conquest of the whole archipelago lasted no less than 94 years, practically a whole century of fighting, precisely in the 15th century, which is enough to show that it was not a military stroll. By way of comparison, the conquest of America took about 40 years. It should be noted that the clash between the indigenous Canary Islanders and the Castilian troops was brutal.
This war involved the Canary aborigines, called Guanches, and the conquistadors, on the one hand sent by the Crown of Castile and on the other sent by the Crown of Portugal. Both kingdoms coveted control of these islands, which were so strategic in their overseas territorial expansion.

It is a wargame for two players, where the Castilians slowly but continuously land on each of the 7 islands through the arrival of ships loaded with conquerors and the Guanches try by all means to stop and expel the newcomers to their earthly paradise. The game is played by secret and simultaneous orders and with the help of two decks of event cards, so the turns are a lot of fun and with variable strategy adapted to the moment.
The Castilian player wins if he has conquered the 7 Canary Islands in the last turn.

—description from the designer

Masqueoca NAC wargames en su proyecto de fomento de juegos con temática nacional ha tenido a bien incluir en su programa uno con temática hasta ahora inédita y original, y que como diseñador canario es una gran satisfacción para mi presentar. Madera contra Acero, La Conquista de Canarias. Ya el titulo nos da una pequeña pista de la desigualdad en armamento en los bandos implicados en esta guerra. Las armas de madera y piedra de los guanches contra el hierro y acero de los conquistadores de la Corona de Castilla. Pero que no llame a engaño, aun siendo una lucha muy desigual, la conquista de todo el archipiélago duró nada menos que 94 años, prácticamente todo un siglo de combates, precisamente el siglo XV, ello es un indicador suficiente para entender que aquello no fue un paseo militar. Como comparación la conquista de America duró unos 40 años. Se hace necesario destacar que el choque entre los indígenas canarios y las tropas castellanas fue brutal.
Esta guerra en la que intervinieron los aborígenes canarios, llamados guanches, y los conquistadores , por un lado enviados por la Corona de Castilla y por otro enviados por la Corona de Portugal. Ya que ambos reinos codiciaban el control de estas islas tan estratégicas en su expansión territorial de ultramar.
Es un wargame para dos jugadores, donde el castellano mediante la llegada lenta pero continua de barcos cargados de conquistadores va desembarcando en cada una de las 7 islas y los guanches intentan por todos los medios frenar y expulsar a los recién llegados a su paraíso terrenal. Se juega mediante ordenes secretas y simultaneas y con la ayuda de dos mazos de cartas de eventos , con lo cual los turnos son muy divertidos y con estrategia variable adaptada al momento.
El jugador castellano ganará si en el ultimo turno ha conquistado las 7 islas canarias.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Imazine (Issue 16 - Winter 1986)
boardgame.description:
Winter Issue 16
Imazine

boardgame.name: Steps
boardgame.description:
Steps is an active board game where players step by step build a tower using wooden plates (Stepses)

Sounds easy?

If your goal is not just to put your Steps on top of the tower but to place it on the narrow game board by throwing accurately over your opponent’s Steps?

It’s a dynamic and a gambling game for one or more players.
It requires knowledge of physics, intelligence, and good decision making.

Each time the game is completely unpredictable and you never know who wins this time.

Includes:
Wooden storage box
72 blocks (Steps)
Playing board
Mat
Tutorial
Dice

Stepses are divided into 6 species. They are of different sizes and weights so that the tower is built unpredictably each time and in any situation you can adjust the slope of the constructed structure with the help of weight and size of the Steps.

Steps must be thrown with the movement of the hand from the bottom up, the distance should be at least of one Steps from yours to the oppnent's Steps. If you do not calculate the force of the throw, the Steps will fly forward and slip or collapse the tower.

The last Steps is always thrown with a flip, in the standard version of the game it is a 180 degree flip. In more advanced versions of the game it can be a flip of 360 degrees or more.

You can constantly improve your throws in the game of Steps, there are a number of tricks with which you can throw your Steps on the tower making the game more exciting and interesting. You can also play with both left and right hands on different sides of the tower, as you can not go to the opponent's side, you need to throw Steps with your hand on the opponent's side. It develops agility well.

To play alone, the player simply needs to throw Steps on the playing field, you win if you throw the whole set of Steps and none of them fall off from the playing board.

More than 12 types of games:
Play alone or with friends, teams and each for himself or one against teams. Just throw the Steps with 180,360 degrees flips. Play with the dice, what number fell on the dice - so many Stepses to throw at once. Play with the color on the dice, what color fell on the dice - such a Stepses you need to throw. Complicate the game with a dice, what number and color fell on the dice so many steppes of this color need to throw at once. Play with dice and flips and become the best Steps player!

boardgame.name: Non Semper Erit Aestas - "It Will Not Always Be Summer"
boardgame.description:
OpenQuest in the Time of the Four Emperors

From the introduction:

In the year 68AD, after the Emperor Nero’s suicide and disgrace, the Roman Empire is torn apart by civil war. Those who would be emperor have withdrawn the legions under their command to fight each-other, leaving the defences of the borders and provinces of the Empire dramatically weakened.

boardgame.name: FLÉAUX
FLÉꜶX
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A baroque fantasy rpg where you play as scoundrels trying to survive in a dangerous world.

From the back of the book:

The world of FLÉꜶX! is on the brink of oblivion. Far from the flickering lights of civilization, lurking in the deepest forests, hidden in the ruins of past empires; gathered behind the mountains at the end of the world, the legions of Chaos await... Ignoring or minimizing the threat, the free peoples of the world fail to see the corruption that is slowly eating away at the foundations of society.

boardgame.name: Song of the North
boardgame.description:
A Zin Never Dies Adventure

From the introduction:

Fimo and Zik liked to explore. Ever since they left their homeland of Tikina, they have enjoyed finding out about all sorts of things they had never heard of before. New races, new settlements, new landscapes. Even blessed lands.

boardgame.name: Usurper Battle System: Titans of Tartarus
boardgame.description:
From the triangular game pieces to the diamond shaped game board you'll have trouble finding anything like what the Usurper Battle System offers and you'll have an even harder time putting this game down once you've learned the rules.

In this campaign (Titans of Tartarus) You'll choose one of the four banished Olympian Gods. You'll build a team of specialized Mortal units and together you'll use them to unleash a Titan's power and escape the prison you've been banished to.

This campaign comes with the Core Rule Set, a game board (Battleboard), 2 full sets of Battle Tokens including 8 Gods, 24 Mortals and 2 Titans.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Sniper Elite: Deluxe Upgrade Kit
boardgame.description:
This was available during the Kickstarter as well as currently available through the publisher's website.

From the publisher:

The Deluxe Upgrade Kit gives you everything you need for the ultimate Sniper Elite experience.

Unique Specialist Miniatures:
Have each Specialist represented on the battlefield, with custom sculpts matching the card artwork for each officer. This includes two miniatures for the Kennel Master’s hounds.
- 6 Unique Specialist miniatures
- 2 Guard Dog miniatures

30 Custom Weighted Clay Shot Tokens & Embroidered Shot Bag:
Make a successful shot even more satisfying with the Custom Weighted Clay Shot Tokens, complete with an oversized embroidered shot bag for them all to fit into.

Teste-Kill Miniature:
Celebrate one of the greatest shots in video game history with the Teste-Kill Miniature, highlighting the expert marksmanship of Allied sniper Karl Fairburne.
- 1 Teste-kill miniature

boardgame.name: Festival of the Lost
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The old man put his quill down, gathered his belongings and stepped outside of his small house. A full moon, clear night sky and a town full of visitors ready to commune with their beloved on the other side of life's veil. Hiroshi mustered whatever strength he had and started his journey towards the Festival of the Lost.

One final journey, for one final quest; deliver the poem to his beloved.

boardgame.name: Heart of Gold
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Legends talk of a goddess who was able to conjure gold out of thin air. They called her, the goddess of dawn, as her body shined bright like a star.

The archaelogical community had been busy for many years now, discovering all sorts of relics of the past. Most of those things were uninteresting and not so useful, meaning that most of the realm's population did not care much for the old things that were dug up now and then. Historians were trying to reconstruct stories of the old world but were having a hard time doing so due to the lack of any sort of material to work with.

boardgame.name: Astral Invitation
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It was always sunny and warm around the village. The hills, the river, and the forest, were all places that you would gladly visit for a walk or even a picnic. It was always calm and peaceful. Until the incident.

"Ah yes, the incident!" would be the response of anyone if you were to ask them what the incident is. That is as much as they would tell you though, as nobody was willing to share more, mostly in fear of what could happen to them if they did. Nobody understood it and nobody dared to try. Except for one person. One, curious, halfling.

boardgame.name: Windrider
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

She could not stop thinking about it. The path was right there and yet she had not found anyone to accompany her in her journey. A whole week had passed and dozens of adventurers stopped by the inn to rest and yet Aniko had not been able to convince a single one of them to join her in her quest. She always thought that, all you needed to do to get help in the realm was offer some coin or the promise of magical loot and then people would line up to accept your quest.

boardgame.name: The Tower of the Starlight Knight
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Once upon a time, there was a kingdom, far in the north of Icewind Dale, in a land where few had ever managed to go to due to the treacherous passing that the mountains below presented to all unweary adventurers. The kingdom of Larthimar it was called and it was famous for two things; its love for larimar stone and its deep connection to religion. Their faith was all about protecting one’s lineage in what they thought was the purest of means. For that reason, they had a huge distaste for anything magical and only believed in marriage between man and woman.

boardgame.name: Daughter of the Wind
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

For most people in the realm of Faerûn, power would be a welcome blessing as it would mean that they would be able to protect themselves as well as those close to them. For Aella, the daughter of the elemental air goddess Akadi, it was a very different story.

boardgame.name: The Pie Shop
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Selbia's Pie Shop is well-known in town. Selbia, a middleaged half-elf woman, has been running the shop for the past two decades, and it has been embraced by the town as one of the tastiest places in the area. Over time, Selbia has added more and more items on the menu, and at the current time, the shop is more of a bakery than a pie shop, with everything from bread to pies to sweets present.

boardgame.name: Of Starlight and Void
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The world of Latakar. A place filled with magic, mystery and treasure. While some see it as the land of adventure, others look at it from a more, mundane, perspective. Some traverse its exotic and constantly shifting landscape to uncover long forgotten history while others, just live their normal lives with their daily routine job and activities.

boardgame.name: The Goblin Lord's Compendium
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This compendium has information on how you can easily implement the bounties and the concept of the Goblin Lord with his Endless Dungeon in your own games. You will be able to find some background lore on the Goblin Lord and the Endless dungeon and also a constantly expanding list of magical items that can be bought with the currency you collect from completing the Goblin Lord's bounties.

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Order Affiliation Pack
boardgame.description:
The minions of Thanos are unleashed in Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Order Affiliation Pack, which combines the characters previously found in the Corvus Glaive & Proxima Midnight and Black Dwarf & Ebony Maw expansion packs.

In addition to miniatures of each of these characters, this pack also includes stat cards featuring updated graphic design for all four as well as all of the Team Tactic cards found in the original packs. Finally, players will also find copies of the Space, Time, Mind, and Reality Infinity Gems that help them unlock the full potential of their Black Order characters.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Dwarf & Ebony Maw
Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Corvus Glaive & Proxima Midnight

boardgame.name: CRIMELAND: Akte Falkenstein
boardgame.description:
CRIME ESCAPE EXPERIENCE FOR HOME - Ideal for a convivial game night with friends and family
CAPTIVATING STORY - More than 25 realistic investigation documents and multimedia content take you into the world of real detectives for 2-3 hours of fun
FUN IN TEAM - For adults and children from 14 years - 1 to 6 people
GIVE AWAY - Perfect gift for all board game nerds, escape room enthusiasts and fans of tricky puzzles
SUSTAINABLE - Crimeland relies on sustainable materials and is a plastic-free & climate-neutral product with resource-saving packaging

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Swan & Supergiant
boardgame.description:
Thanos' Black Order gains two powerful new members with Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Swan & Supergiant.

A princess of an alternate Earth, Black Swan uses her ability to project eyebeams of energy and superhuman physique to support the Mad Titan's conquest of worlds. Joining her is Supergiant, an omnipath and telepathic parasite. Her powers allow her to read the minds of and control anyone she encounters, which she uses to steal and devour the intellects of her hapless prey. Beyond their own powers, Black Swan and Supergiant also bring three Team Tactic cards that help them synergize with other members of the Black Order, making them an even more formidable fighting force.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: CRIMECASES: Akte 001 Kunstfehler
boardgame.description:
A MULTIMEDIA HUNT WITH REAL INDICATIONS - Detected with real letters, credit cards, photos, documents, and digitally on the Internet - the perpetrator has left traces everywhere. Combine together and collect evidence. Everything is allowed in this detective game - just like in real police work! Check your solutions on the game website and the inspector will tell you if you're right.

THE PERFECT GAME NIGHT because there are no complicated rules, you can start right away. It doesn't matter whether you're a puzzle game beginner or a pro: Thanks to the selectable difficulty in the game app, every team gets their money's worth. Whether as a gift, for a murder mystery evening, a murderous dinner party or just because - this Cold Case crime scene game sweeps everyone away.

CAPTIVATING STORY - Two bodies are found at an art gala. How did the botox doctor and the art hunter die? What was a windy car mogul and an ambitious influencer doing at the crime scene? Find the killer, determine the motives and solve the Murder Mystery!
?

NOW YOU ARE THE COMMISSIONER - Become a homicide detective. Places the perpetrators in an exciting jungle of intrigues, clues and spicy details. But be careful: the perpetrator is still one step ahead of you! The game does not have to be destroyed and can therefore be played more often.
? If you are not 100% satisfied with the escape room game, we find a solution - just write to us! What are you waiting for? Add Crime Cases detective game to cart now!

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Quinjet Terrain Pack
boardgame.description:
The new S.H.I.E.L.D. Affiliation gets a stunning new terrain piece for their operations with Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Quinjet Terrain Pack. Combining the technological prowess of Wakadan engineering and Stark Industries, Quinjets have served both the Avengers and S.H.I.E.L.D. operatives as a rapid- response vehicle able to carry them wherever a crisis emerges. Quinjets are a crucial part of how the Earth’s mightiest heroes and covert teams can arrive wherever they are needed most, and this pack deepens players’ immersion in their games of Marvel: Crisis Protocol by adding one to the battlefield.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Golden Animal
boardgame.description:
Golden Animal is an auction game for 3 to 5 players where you try to attract golden animals, such as cheetahs, giraffes, and lions - though also elephants, zebras, and rabbits.

A deck of cards is used for both what you are bidding on and what you may bid with. The auction is broken into three simultaneous lots: a mountain area, a river area, and an in-between area (though these are referential only, and not thematic.)

Players program their bids for each of the three areas, by arranging the cards in their hand. The highest bid for each area will take a card, followed by the next highest bid.

If a player wins food cards or rabbits, these are placed face up in front of a player. If a player wins a rock card, it is added to their hand. If a player wins a gold card, it can be discarded or swapped for another card in their hand.

After the auction, the player return the cards they used in the previous round to their hand (allowing for any additions or exchanges from the rock and gold cards), new cards are added to the areas, and the game play repeats.

After 7 rounds, the players compare who has the most in each of the three food types, and golden animal cards are awarded. Players add the points collected from those to points (both positive and negative) on other cards in their hand, and the player with the most points wins.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: 新ボードゲーム党 (New Board Game Party)

boardgame.name: Магнитус
boardgame.description:
Magnitus is a dexterity game for 2 to 4 people. At the beginning of the game, each player receives a set of magnets. In his turn, the player must put a magnet on the game board so that other magnets from the board are not attracted to it. If he fails to do this, then the player takes all this magnets in his hand.

The player who gets rid of all his magnets first wins.

В игре "Магнитус" Вам предстоит стать творцом галактики, но даже самым могущественным творцам приходится мириться с силой гравитации. Заполните свою Галактику новыми небесными телами и не дайте ей схлопнуться.

boardgame.name: Zevoas: The Hyena Men of Zul
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The feral, feline-form humanoid Zevoas, or Hyena Men, haunt the wastes of Zul, seeking battle and scavenging for prey. Natural predators, Zevoas savor the thrill of the hunt. A new species of Gnoll, Zevoas are among the most numerous (and most universally feared) of Zul’s humanoid races, inhabiting wastelands, deserts, grasslands, woodlands, and mountains. And now you can use them as villains, NPCs, or even play one as a character in the World’s Greatest Roleplaying Game. “Zevoas: The Hyena Men of Zul” includes stat blocks for three entire Zevoa clans (Fire Jumpers, Dangling Eye, and Kaftars), shamanic magic items, adventure hooks, tips for roleplaying Zevoas and much more.

Featuring original art by Jen C. Mars, whose work is featured in “The Monsters Know What They’re Doing,” by Keith Ammann.

Includes:

New gnolls (Zevoas)
New clans: The Fire Jumpers, Dangling Eye, and Kaftars
New Zevoa shamanic magic items
Adventure Hooks
Playing a Zevoa as a PC
A brief history of Gnolls

boardgame.name: Fires of Old
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fire cult thought long lost from the world of Latakar has returned. Now, they seek to bring their deity back to the material plane, and only a willing group of adventurers can stop them...

Recommended Average Party Level (APL): 10
Experience from Completion: ~31,000 XP
General Theme: Elimination
Setting: Any, Starlight Chronicles
Sessions to Finish: x1 session - x3 hours

boardgame.name: NPCs: Wanted 06
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be wanted by the law or other authorities.

For in-person games, print out these pages and clip out a Wanted poster as a handout. For virtual games, show your players the section of the file for the fugitive you want them aware of.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Human male for assault with a sword
Dwarven male for animation of the dead
Human female for aiding enemies of the crown
Gnomish male for smuggling and mischief

boardgame.name: Unique Items: Collection 13
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whether found in a shop, as part of a treasure hoard in a dungeon, or simply in a ditch at the side of the road, feel free to add these unique items to your next gaming session. Some are magical, most are mysterious, some are less-than-interesting.

Items include:

"The meat cleaver" - a sword that can only be used by the strongest
A cloak that gives benefit to those hiding in the woods
A mask that gives visions of the past and future
Can your players survive, , , The Needles of Woe?

boardgame.name: To the Depths
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this salty and bone chilling adventure, characters find themselves lost at sea and down on their luck. The Rugged Runner, the ship which is bearing the characters to faraway lands, has been stranded amidst thick fog and jagged rocks. What’s worse, it is under attack by a horrifying beast! The cursed monstrosity seeks the sailors’ bodies to create an army of abominations and attack the main land. In order to survive, the characters must uncover the secrets of what lies below the waves and save as many poor souls as possible, lest they themselves never return to shore again.

This adventure can take place on any large body of water, far enough from land that no one would think to swim back, and is designed for 3-6 player characters of levels 2-4.

boardgame.name: Pixelate
boardgame.description:
Unleash your unlimited imagination with limited blocks in Pixelate, the bad pixel art game from Ridley's Games! Make an array of weird and wonderful creations with colorful wooden pixel blocks for other players to guess. The better you do, the less blocks you have to work with, until you're hilariously trying to make a lightbulb with only 4 pixels!

Contains:
Instructions
84 picture cards
12 clue cards
4 score cards
60 wooden pixels
1 art board.

boardgame.name: Abszolút képtelen sztorik
boardgame.description:
Abszolút képtelen sztorik is the third game in the word-and story-related Abszolút series published by book and game publisher Pagony.

In the game box you'll find 30 two-sided story cards (with 9 elements of a story, numbered), 9 number cards, cards to vote for each player, a notebook and a story book.

Draw one of the number cards. Everyone looks at their story card and writes the first (in later rounds, next) sentence for the story. They read it aloud and players vote with cards (0 to 3 points) for the best sentence (including their own). The sentence that gets the highest score will be written in the storybook. The player who wrote this sentence scores 3 points, everyone else scores as many points as the number they assigned to the winning player.

Keep writing the story this way, eventually using all the number cards. (For a shorter game, only certain numbers are used.) The player with the most points total wins, but of course it's the story that you've written together that matters.

boardgame.name: Magical and Fantastic Nets
boardgame.description:
"This supplement includes 16 magical nets, 7 nets made from fantastic materials, and 10 magic items based on non-combat nets, counteracting nets and restraints, or complementing the use of a net in battle.

Inside, you'll find the following:

Rules for advancing the escape DCs, AC, and hp of magical nets
Nets made from fantastic materials, such as mithral, giant spider silk, or ectoplasm
Nets specially made to catch ghosts, elementals, and other incorporeal or formless creatures
Netting to magically camouflage your camp
A magic bracelet that slings webs
A legendary kraken-slayer's net and trident
An extradimensional creature disguised as a net that consumes its victims whole—and certainly would never try to do that to you!
Your very own domesticated assassin vine
And more!"

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Adventure Realms: The Last Fantasy
boardgame.description:
The Last Fantasy In this Expansion, you aren't just racing through the dungeon anymore, you are also dealing with corruption. If you aren't participating in the dungeon, you are seen to the rest of the world as corrupt. Now, you'll be losing resources between turns if you are corrupted, however, you'll gain benefits for being a certain amount of corrupt. Who knew being bad can be so good?

You'll also have Leader cards to choose from in the beginning of the game. These will give the players a special ability as well as a player specified quest they can complete. This gives players more of a focus at the start of the game.

There are also a ton of new Adventure and Hero cards that may activate when you reach a certain amount of corruption.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Feed the Kraken: Bonus Character Cards
boardgame.description:
Part of the Funtails shipping donation rewards to battle the massively increased shipping costs.

4 bonus character cards. These 4 cards look just as stunning as the other character cards and their effects have been playtested thoroughly for potential use in a future expansion. You will receive a PDF File from which you can print the cards. Place them in a sleeve in front of an unused card and start exploring!
-description from publisher's website

These cards were available as print and play document on the Funtails online store for some time.

boardgame.name: Isla
boardgame.description:
"...My satchel is packed and heavy with journals, sketchbooks, bell jars and test tubes. I am ready to fulfil my destiny, learning the secrets of this place and I must hurry as I feel almost as though I am competing with myself to become the master of this place. What Flora, Fauna and Fossil will I discover as I explore - after such a journey - this new world; Isla!"

Draw your journey across Isla, discovering the island's famous flora, fauna, and fossils. Following the end of your travels, if you’ve explored more of the jungle and discovered lots of species you’ll earn yourself international prestige. In contrast, areas unexplored will tarnish your reputation. When everyone has finished exploring the island, the explorer with the highest victory points wins.

The game is played through a series of rounds. Each round, players plan their day choosing to rest, move or research. One player will roll all 5 movement dice, players who chose to move can select a die result to explore Isla, those who rest can recover their lowest value die, and those who chose to research will select a card showing the flora, fauna or fossil they’ve discovered to earn themselves reputation points. But it's not so easy, the further you travel through the jungle, you may stumble over a branch, pick up a poisonous plant or discover you may not be alone on the island. As explorers, you are tasked with researching the species you discover so hurry before someone else claims the discovery!

An explorative roll and write game in which players uncover the mysteries of a curious island whilst battling exhaustion.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Linelith
boardgame.description:
Solve puzzles embedded in rocks and crystals as you explore a colorful, serene alien asteroid. Discover a few clever twists as you progress in this short and sweet puzzle experience.

Source: [Steam page].

boardgame.name: Blacks & Whites: 50th Anniversary Edition – Go Brandon Variant Pack
boardgame.description:
An expansion pack to Blacks & Whites: 50th Anniversary Edition – because racism didn't end in 2020!

All-new game cards based on the events of 2021 & 2022 – the pandemic, the Biden administration, etc. – with new jokes, artwork, and the harsh realities of a “post-racial” society.

9 "Proof of Vaccination" cards, 4 new property/Deed cards, and 23 new game cards for "vaccinated-only" players.

boardgame.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 559 - June 2022)
boardgame.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 559
June 2022

Ignorable Theme: Do any NPCs / PCs / magic artifacts have True Names? Think about Rumplestiltskin whose plot could only be foiled if his True Name was known.
boardgame.rpg: Good Society: A Jane Austen Role-Playing Game

boardgame.name: Drainus
boardgame.description:
This is a side-scrolling shooting game in which you take control of the "Drainus", the Kharlal Empire's most cutting-edge fighter with the ability to absorb energy bullets, and take down the enemy ships zipping through space.

Source: [Steam page].

boardgame.name: Homeworld: Revelations 2d20 RPG Quickstart
boardgame.description:
'Distributor Blurb'

A NEW TABLETOP ROLEPLAYING ODYSSEY BEGINS; YOUR JOURNEY STARTS ON FREE RPG DAY! Complete starter rule set and thrilling adventure for the forthcoming Homeworld: Revelations 2d20 RPG, with plenty of hints and tips for new GMs.

boardgame.name: Drift Crisis
boardgame.description:
From the Back of the Book

Hyperspace is broken! In a catastrophic instant, commonplace faster-than-light travel, made possible by the Drift, fails. Travelers vanish midflight, communications scramble, and the Drift’s progenitor god Triune falls mysteriously silent. In the aftermath, empires cling to far-flung holdings, opportunists exploit the chaos, and everyone demands to know what triggered this crisis -- and how it can be solved. With Starfinder Drift Crisis, you can dive right into this galaxy-spanning adventure and determine what happens next!


More than 100 new player options, from class options and themes to equipment, feats, and spells!



Twenty detailed adventure seeds that provide a framework for playing through dozens of Drift Crisis stories, whether in encounters, adventures, or entire campaigns.



Deep dives on the myriad effects of the Drift Crisis on factions, worlds, systems, and the galaxy at large.



A toolbox with a vast store of information for running adventures in the Drift Crisis, from dozens of unique treasures and 20 new creatures to rich nonplayer character profiles and information on adapting Adventure Paths.

boardgame.name: The Great Wall: Board Game Amplifier 3D Printed Models
boardgame.description:
3D Printed Walls and Towers for The Great Wall board game.

3 wall sections composed each of Base, Middle and Top tier wall. All modeled in different textures. Red worker placement spots are depicted along with wall strength and resource requirements to upgrade.

4 towers include red worker placement spots.

boardgame.name: Homeworld: Revelations Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




'Publisher Blurb'

“100 years ago, a satellite detected an object under the sands of the Great Desert…”

Homeworld: Revelations will give fans of the original Homeworld game the exciting opportunity to view the universe from a new perspective, taking on the role of the crew aboard one of the Kushan fleet’s ships. Whether it’s joining the Mothership on its odyssey, or helping re-establish the Hiigaran homeworld, there will be endless adventures.

Homeworld: Revelations expands on what we know of the Kushan people and the game’s major factions, like the Kadesh and the Taiidan. Fans of the universe will learn that there are more incredible secrets hidden within the Guidestone which can be discovered through the roleplaying game. You can expect more detail on the people of the whirlpool galaxy so players can create their own stories of discovery and adventure, revisit locations from Homeworld to uncover their mysteries, and even explore the events of the Exodus to find out what else the Kushan discovered, gained and lost on that famous journey.

“On the stone was etched a galactic map and a single word more ancient than the clans themselves… Hiigara – Our home.”

Modiphius has employed the expertise of Martin Cirulis, one of the original writers of Homeworld, to consult on the setting and lore, along with Homeworld experts at Gearbox Entertainment and Blackbird Interactive.
