The Modiphius 2d20 roleplaying game system has been adapted and developed by head of RPGs Sam Webb and line manager Virginia Page from Star Trek Adventures (developed by Nathan Dowdell; Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of, Mutant Chronicles), based on the original 2d20 system design by Jay Little (Mutant Chronicles, Star Wars: Edge of the Empire).

A fantastic team of dedicated writers, many long-standing fans of the Homeworld games, have been assembled to work on the roleplaying game, including Mike ‘Norsehound’ Ptak, Oz Mills, Jason Brick, Andy Peregrine, Marie Tokuda, John Kennedy and John Dodd. One of the original artists for the Homeworld video game, Aaron Kambeitz, has created the cover art for the roleplaying game whilst art directors Katya Thomas (Dune: Adventures in the Imperium, Star Trek Adventures, John Carter of Mars, Conan: Adventures in an Age Undreamed Of) and Kris Aubin (Dune: Adventures in the Imperium, Achtung! Cthulhu) have been working to provide fantastic new artwork to bring Homeworld: Revelations to life!

“This is Fleet Command.”

A 300 page full-colour royal size (234x156mm) sewn hardback designed for ease of use at the table.
Step inside the fleet and for the first time discover the personal story of the Hiigarans
The history of the Kushan people - From their origins on Hiigara, into exile on Kharak, and back again. With adventure ideas for play in any of these periods throughout their history
Explore the harsh desert world of Kharak and the cities and societies found there.
Create a character from some of the most famous of the Kushan Kiith - Naabal, Soban, S’jet, Paktu, Manaan, and Somtaaw.
Take your role as part of the crew on any of the classic Homeworld vessels
Discover life on board the Mothership as part of its many important divisions – Command, Tech and Engineering, or Exploration and Research.
Details on all other factions and their technology - Taiidan, Bentusi, Turanic Raiders, Kadeshi, The Progenitors and the Galactic Council
Covers the events of Homeworld 1 and Homeworld 2, Homeworld Cataclysm and Deserts of Kharak
You’re not grounded! Simple ship combat rules give you everything you need to take command of fighters, corvettes, frigates, Capital ships, Super Capital ships and of course the iconic Mothership herself!
Packed full of never-before-seen Homeworld art to bring the universe to life in a completely new light
A new iteration of Modiphius’ 2d20 RPG system designed from the ground up to let you dive deep into the events of Homeworld.

boardgame.name: Homeworld Revelations: Quickstart
boardgame.description:
'Publisher Blurb'

Welcome to The Dreamlands team.

Join Mevath Sagald on an archaeological expedition to the planet Kharak. You and your team have been brought together to gather historical records and artifacts from the wreckage of the great ship, the Khar-Toba. However, you are far from the only interested party descending on the ruin and at this point, the race is on.

Can you be the first to the prize? Well, there’s only one way to find out.

This FREE 68 page Quickstart PDF contains:

Complete starter rule set for Homeworld: Revelations 2d20 with plenty of hints and tips for new GMs.
A thrilling adventure leading a team of archaeologists into a thousand year old space ship wreck to retrieve valuable artifacts.
Five pre-generated characters so you can pick up and play the game straight away.
Enjoy your first taste of the infinite possibilities of the Homeworld: Revelations universe.

boardgame.name: The Cuilling Shadow
boardgame.description:
An enemy armada invades! The heroes of New Horizon must launch their own forces to withstand the attack and eventually take the fight to the evil cult’s leader on the dark side of the moon. But to truly save their home, they must face the monster at the source of the deadly radiation threatening to kill every sentient creature in the system!

This Starfinder Adventure Path volume concludes the Horizons of the Vast Adventure Path and includes:

"The Culling Shadow," a Starfinder adventure for 11th-level characters, by Landon Winkler.
Ways to continue your Horizons of the Vast campaign beyond the final fight, by Isis Wozniakowska.
A toolbox featuring a description of the Negative Energy Plane, options for players to harness the power of that void, a collection of dangerous creatures, and a glimpse at a frozen, chalky world, by Iris Flanagan, Jenny Jarzabski, Georg Mir, Andrew Mullen, Hilary Moon Murphy, Dave Nelson, Jess Nevins, Thea Seals, and Landon Winkler.
Statistics and deck plans for an AbadarCorp long-haul freighter, by Landon Winkler

boardgame.name: Golf+
boardgame.description:
QUEST 2 ONLY***




We're really sorry, but full course will only work on the Quest 2.

GOLF+ is the ultimate VR Golf experience. Play real world courses with friends, hangout at Topgolf for a night of music and games, or enjoy our epic putting courses with Pro Putt.

- Modern clubhouse
- Range and practice area
- Alpine mountain course
- Cliffs ocean course
- Valhalla Golf Club - Louisville, Kentucky
- Wolf Creek Golf Club - Mesquite, Nevada (IAP)
- Callaway clubs
- Multiplayer


Below is available on Quest 1***




Throw on some music and smash some drives at this one of a kind Topgolf venue! Join public games or host your own private lounge where you and 7 of your friends can hang out for hours. Want some sun? Enjoy our epic Pro Putt putting courses!

- All your favorite Topgolf games
- Multiplayer
- Various Topgolf venue games like corn hole
- Beautiful putting courses to help you escape
- Competition to match your skill level
- Achievements and leaderboards for bragging rights!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Ecosfera, Rewilding the World
boardgame.description:
A cooperative deck-building game, with an individual version, in which we will have to get cards from the plant kingdom and the animal kingdom to form different ecosystems and restore the wild nature before it is too late.

We start by placing four decks of animal cards, four decks of plant cards and five decks with different elements; air, soil, sun, water and time, in the middle of the playing space.
On the side we will place a deck of catastrophy cards, seven cards representing different biomas and seven penalty tiles.

In the beginning each player receives one card of each element and two catastrophy cards.
All players shuffle their cards and place four of them in front them. Depending on what combination of cards a player has in front of her/him, the player will get element cards, plant cards, animal cards or win a bioma tile. If the player isn't able to take any card he/she will get a catastrophe card. The player ends the turn by placing four new cards in front of him/her.
If a player places three catastrophe cards on the table or three cards from the same element, a penalty tile is placed.

Some cards will allow you to do other actions such as, shuffle the plant or animal cards, give a card to another player or discard it or get one more card from your deck.

You win all together if you manage to place all the seven bioma tiles.

You lose the game if you place seven penalty tiles.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Micro Bots: Duel
boardgame.description: Micro Bots is a strategic duelling game where you must outmanoeuvre, and outwit, your opponent. Card effects (attacking, moving, etc.) become more powerful based on the number of cards you have previously placed. So the order you play your cards determines your strategy - do you hold back your big attacks for maximum firepower, or deplete your opponent’s defences with a first strike?

boardgame.name: Wrummy
boardgame.description:
Wrummy (Word Rummy) is a card game where players collect letter fragments to construct words. The game is played similar in concept to the card game 500 Rummy.

160 cards comprise single letters plus 2- and 3-letter fragments (biography, trigraphs).

[The above from the rules sheet.]

Players are dealt 7 cards, and the top card of the deck is turned over to start the discard pile. In their turn, a player:

- Draws:
—- The top card of the deck.
—- Any card of the discard pile, and all cards above it. This can only be done if the bottom card drawn is immediately used to make a word from the hand.
- Does one of the following:
—- Melds a new word using cards from the hand.
—- Add one or more letter from the hand to a word on the table make one or more new words using all its letters, and claiming the new word if previously owned by another player.
- Discards a card from the hand.

The round ends when a player empties their hand. Players score for all the words they own, and subtract the value of all cards left in their hand. Play until someone reaches an agreed goal total.

boardgame.name: Finding Atlantis
boardgame.description:
Finding Atlantis is a competitive deduction game with unique app-generated puzzles.

Players move their submarines on the map and choose actions from their deck of cards, which include inspecting the ocean floor, stealing artifacts from their opponents and surfacing to reset their deck. Players track their findings on a hidden map, trying to be be the first to fully discover all spaces of Atlantis.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Raidziu Loto
boardgame.description:
A very simple game for learning letters in the Lithuanian alphabet. There are 8 cardboard boards (7” x 8.5”), on which are all the letters of the alphabet, 4 per board, each with a picture; and 64 cardboard tiles (2.5” x 2.75”), each with a letter on it. To play, the tiles are scattered face up on the table; a child takes a board and looks for the letters on the board, and on finding one, takes the tile, covers the letter on their board, and says the letter and the item pictured that starts with that letter. The one who completes their board first wins.

It also says words and sentences can be made with the tiles, and indeed the frequency of the letters looks like it correlates with the frequency of use in everyday language use; but there are no rules for games or activities for spelling words.

boardgame.name: Auction Charades
boardgame.description: A fun and extremely competitive version of the classic game of Charades, 'AUCTION CHARADES' brings in hilarious and challenging variations, multi-difficulty levels, over 750 Bollywood and 750 Hollywood/TV movies, all with the exhilarating thrill of an Auction for time! One of the only games that can be played by much larger groups, connects with a very diverse demographic and is always engaging everyone around.

boardgame.name: Zombicide: Chronicles - The Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Zombicide Chronicles is a stand-alone roleplaying game set in the famous setting of the Zombicide board games. Take a deep dive into this rich universe, create your own Survivor from scratch (or use a ready-to-play one!), and prepare yourself for the end of the world.

But this isn't your everyday nightmare about the Zombie apocalypse. In Zombicide Chronicles, you show the undead that the living are still trying to fight back, and you got plent of guns and willpower to prove it!

This book gives you the main rules and Mission types to live your own Zombicide adventure. With quick and easy mechanics, and gameplay that that can be enhanced by the use of the Zombicide board game miniatures and components, you and your friends will soon be facing entire Zombie Hordes, meeting interesting characters, and exploring a huge metropolis with 10 different areas and unlimited opportunities to keep hope alive and the dead truly dead this time.

Now, it's time to ask yourself...

What will your survivor story be?

Dive Into the World of Zombicide Like Never Before
There’s a zombie plague overrunning the world. The recently-dead are roaming around, hunting the living, ready to tear them apart on sight. Some survivors chose to hide away in bunkers or caves, but that’s not you. You’re going to attack these zombies head on. You’re going to commit Zombicide.
Zombicide Chronicles was created by the designers behind the acclaimed The One Ring RPG, in collaboration with Need Games, and challenges players to work together, trust one another, and form strategies to fight the zombies if they want to stay alive.

boardgame.name: The Maze Explorers: Dark World
boardgame.description:
You and your fellow intrepid explorers have chosen to venture into a dark unmapped maze.

Using only your wits, a flashlight and a limited supply of batteries you must navigate and expose the hidden maze path. You will encounter artifacts that help or hinder you. You may even find yourself stranded in the dark. Be the hero that exposes the maze path and finds the exit!

Your goal is to create a complete, unbroken maze path between the Maze Entrance and the Maze Exit and be the first Explorer to exit the maze. However, be careful not to get stranded in the maze without flashlight Batteries to light your way.

The Maze Explorers – Dark World is the first in a series of maze worlds. Each world will have its own set of unique artifacts and challenges. Each world will be playable as a stand-alone game or can be combined into a larger meta-world.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: GOOCON Dice 1v1 Basketball
boardgame.description:
The dice determine distance traveled and field goal percentage.
The player controls the walking direction.
Attacker can choose to move or shoot.

First to 15 points wins.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Goocon CO., LTD (雁隼有限公司)

boardgame.name: Rough!: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
Earn the respect of your fellow citizens by being the first to gain 12 stars and making it to Starfish Town. But be wary, the landscape is treacherous, and you will have to be prepared to encounter flash floods, lightning, crows, worms, earthquakes, high winds and even bears! This is a turn-based, resource-managing, survival, racing game. This is Rough baby!
Traversing forests, and lakes, mountains and open fields, would be a challenge, but with the aid of a few scattered trading posts, caves and tents, you'll be able to equip and assist yourself along the way.

Each turn a player will be able to roll a custom dice 3 times to hike their pawn across the open grid-like board, gathering resources onto their player mat freely as they go. With every roll of the dice you can get a hike(Move 1 space), a hungry(discard 1 Berry or Fish and Move 1 space), or a disaster(end your turn and draw a Disaster Card). Throughout gameplay you will acquire cards that give you special abilities during future turns, make trades at Trading Posts located on the board for helpful tools and even have the chance to make a friend with a bear.
Player's have a limited amount of space in their backpack, so they have to be strategic with what and how much of each resource to carry along with them.
The most unique mechanic of the game is the Disaster Deck. The backs of the cards are disasters that will happen to the board or all players(everyone at the table sees this side), but the fronts are helpful abilities that only you can see and use. So as long as you are holding on to the cards in your hand, the disasters on those cards will always be a threat to the progress of all players.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Eldritch Akasha: Obsessions of Mortality
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The knowledge of one’s own mortality is often learned from a young age, and for many this knowledge inspires a looming dread over the remainder of one’s life. For some, this looming dread sparks motivation to overcome, an obsession to surpass their frail mortal form. This obsession with mortality drives each individual to their own goals, seeking a wide variety of methods to alter their body, extend their lives, or cast off their original flesh entirely. This book contains recordings of a number of those methods and information on those who would accomplish them.

Eldritch Akasha: Obsessions of Mortality expands on the Akashic Magic subsystem for PF1e with brand new options themed around altering ones own body with flesh warping magics!

Contained within this books is a reprint of the core chassis of the Promethean, new promethean Obsessions and Forbidden Knowledge, new archetypes for the Eclipse, Promethean, and Radiant, new class features for the Daevic, Nexus, and Vizier, new variant heritages for the Avead, brand new feats, and a suite of new fleshwarp veils!

This book heavily features the Promethean, originally made available in Eldritch Essences: Promethean published by Lost Spheres Publishing. This book contains the core chassis of the class, but does not feature any of the Favored Class Bonuses, Obsessions, Forbidden Knowledge, or Veils printed in that book. This book provided you everything you need to play a promethean, but the options provided to you will be more limited than when using both that book and this book together.

boardgame.name: Cultists' Hidden Fane
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Add depth and flavour to the cultists' fanes in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Marvel Champions: Das Kartenspiel – Mutant Genesis
Marvel Champions: El Juego de Cartas – Génesis Mutante
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Mutant Genesis
boardgame.description:
The world is always in need of heroes. In order to truly achieve peace, there are times when we must put aside our differences and focus on doing what is right. That is exactly what the X-Men do, and their story is all about their fight to protect a world that hates and fears them. Now, the X-Men have finally joined the fight in Marvel Champions: The Card Game!

As the game’s fifth campaign expansion, Mutant Genesis adds a plethora of classic X-Men characters to the scene, including two new playable heroes, Colossus and Shadowcat, each of which comes with a pre-built deck ready to play from the get-go. Face off against iconic villains, such as Sabretooth, Sentinels, and Magneto, and work together to overcome a fresh batch of challenges. This expansion includes five brand-new scenarios, each of which can be played individually or as part of a larger campaign.

Whether you’re a longtime fan or have only just started playing, anyone who enjoys Marvel Champions won’t want to miss out on Mutant Genesis!

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Marvel Champions – The Card Game

boardgame.name: Villains Next Door
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Villains create conflict. Conflict creates the call to action every story needs. Without a villain, there’s no story!

Villains Next Door is a collection of bad guys for fantasy games: the book contains dozens of ready-to-use villains, each unique and fully realized.

Though created with Fifth Edition in mind, each villain is designed to be used in any RPG system. Kabouter Games assembled a crack team of diverse international indie designers to create Villains Next Door just for you!

Each villain comes with a sumptuous portrait painted by some of history’s most famous artists, courtesy of the Rijksmuseum’s Rijksstudio program.

Finally, each villain comes with three story seeds around which you can build exciting adventures.

Start your next adventure. Antagonize your players.

Create YOUR story — with Villains Next Door!

boardgame.name: Quirks & Foibles: d66 Tables for Generating Character Traits
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quirks: they’re fun! Weird foibles can either make characters more interesting or help you create a character’s demeanor when you get stuck. If you’re a Ref/GM, you may find your NPC portrayals are becoming a bit “same-y”. Use quirks to add spice to your roleplaying experience. Bring your characters to life!

There are six d66 tables in this book. You can use the tables in a number of ways!

boardgame.name: Steps: Named Steps Case
boardgame.description:
Case cover for Named Steps (NS).
You can always carry your NS with you, so that wherever there is a game you can win with your NS.

Genuine durable leather
Hand seam
Plywood frame
A reliable button so that the NS does not fall out
Carbine to fasten the case to the straps on the pants or backpack or as a keychain.
Different colors to choose from.

boardgame.name: Psychic Incursions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Galaxy is full of strange and wondrous beings, many possessing equally strange and wondrous abilities of the mind. Psionic communications, telekinetic strikes, and empathic manipulation are all challenges awaiting unprepared crews exploring the cosmos. While deep space exploration may not be for the faint-hearted, it’s definitely not for the weak-willed.

This packet presents ten detailed mission briefs oriented around a variety of psionic and psychic incursions, each of which you can modify for use in your Star Trek Adventures campaigns set during The Next Generation era (approximately 2360–2379) or any other era of play with minor modifications. Each mission brief is designed to stand alone, though they could easily be strung together into a story arc or added to an existing campaign.

boardgame.name: Steps: Belt
boardgame.description:
Strap made of strong and reliable cloth, length adjustable. The belt is attached to the box with reliable accessories. You can carry the game on your shoulders or ride it on a bicycle, scooter, skateboard, roller skates and other vehicles where there is no place to put the game.
Different colors to choose from

boardgame.name: Full Moon: The Beast of Gevaudan
boardgame.description:
Full Moon: The Beast of Gevaudan is a brutal solo roll and write inspired by the myth of the beast that ravaged the French countryside in the mid 1700s.

In this game you play as the beast, a werewolf struggling to survive as paranoia grows constantly, unable control your werewolf form.

Can you maintain your village guise for the month? the season? the year? The experience is harrowing, and you will need to push your luck to see how long you can survive. Are you ready to roll the dice?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: John Carter of Mars: Ruins of Korad Tile Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Explore the Ruins of Barsoom!

Prepare to battle dangerous creatures and uncover the hidden secrets in the once magnificent, now ruined city of Korad. With the John Carter of Mars gaming tiles, you can adventure and battle your foes within the ruined city to seek glory, honor or treasures lost to the ages.

- 4 Full-sized, double sided tiles. (9.45” x 9.45”)
- 4 Half-sized, double sided tiles. (9.45 x 4.72”)
- Designed for use with John Carter of Mars: Adventures on the Dying
- World of Barsoom 32mm scale miniatures.
- Includes FREE PDF versions to download right away

boardgame.name: John Carter of Mars: Airships of Barsoom Tile Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Take to the Skies!

Prepare to travel the skies of Barsoom! With the John Carter of Mars gaming tiles you can choose between proudly flying the colors of Helium or Zodanga, as you fight for control of, and battle your foes on the decks of a mighty Martian airship.

- 4 Full-sized, double sided tiles. (9.45” x 9.45)
- 4 Half-sized, double sided tiles. (9.45 x 4.72”)
- Designed for use with John Carter of Mars: Adventures on the Dying
- World of Barsoom 32mm scale miniatures.
- Includes FREE PDF versions to download right away

boardgame.name: Kyudo
boardgame.description:
Whatever you do at today's archery contest, try to keep the spectators satisfied so that they don't wander off to watch someone else. Lose all of your spectators, and you can't win!

Each player in Kyudo takes one of the four role cards and a scoring sheet that depicts the central target, five flags (one in each of the five colors on the dice), and twenty spectators. The starting player takes the four dice, and other players mark off 1-3 spaces on flags.

On a turn, roll the four dice up to three times, re-rolling dice as you wish. The dice show five colors (that match the flags and the colored rings on the target) and an arrow. For each arrow, you can assign it to a color that you rolled, then mark off a space on the central target. With two arrows, one blue, and one red, for example, you can mark off two blue spaces, two red spaces, or one blue and one red space. Once you've marked off all the spaces in a colored ring, any additional "hits" on that color cause your opponents to lose spectators — because you're clearly far more awesome than they are!

If you roll two or more dice of the same color, you can mark off an equal number of spaces on the flag of that color; when you mark off the final space in the corner of a flag, you receive that flag's bonus, such as marking off any two spaces, or taking a token that lets you change a die to the face of your choice, or taking a different token that allows you not to lose spectators during a turn of your choice.

If you roll four arrows, all opponents lose four spectators, and if you roll four different colors, you use the special power of your role, such as forcing others to use only three dice for a round or adding a green or blue circle to opponents' targets.

If you lose all of your spectators, you're out of the game. If you're the last archer in the game, you win! Alternatively, if you've marked off all the spaces on your target and you have the most spectators, you win.

boardgame.name: A Rainbow For The Storm
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Escolar the boggle is a well known restaurateur in The Tidalbore Isles, a domain in the Feywild. He operates a sushi and seafood cafe from his island home. His cafe is a favorite of the Fey that live in the Tidalbore Isles, but not everyone is so easy to please. A pair of renowned traveling food critics who are known throughout all the planes of existence have visited the cafe and are less than impressed with what the cafe has to offer. They have given Escolar a second chance, and thus Escolar requires some brave adventures to scour the Isles to obtain various ingredients to really impress these critics.

A 4-Hour Teir 2 Dungeoncraft (AL) Adventure for Characters of Level 5-10, Part 5 of The Tidalbore Isles Series, Optimized for a group of 5 players with an APL8

Includes image flies of the maps for VTT programs.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Age of Conan: Set of Skull Coins
boardgame.description:
20 Skull Coins, to use in the game as "Crom, Count the Dead" metal tokens.

Replaces the "Crom, count the dead!" cardboard tokens.

Hand crafted by Shire Post Mint with the same techniques of true coinage.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game
Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game – Adventures in Hyboria

boardgame.name: Age of Conan: Set of Scroll Coins
boardgame.description:
20 Scroll Coins, to use in the game as "Sorcery" metal tokens.

Replaces the Sorcery cardboard tokens.

Hand crafted by Shire Post Mint with the same techniques of true coinage.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game
Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game – Adventures in Hyboria

boardgame.name: Age of Conan: Bag of King Conan's Coins
boardgame.description:
King Conan's Coins to make your Kingdom stand out from your opponents! Each set includes 3 5-value coins and 5 1-value coins.

Replaces the Gold cardboard tokens.

Hand crafted by Shire Post Mint with the same techniques of true coinage.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game
Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game – Adventures in Hyboria

boardgame.name: Jojo's Bizarre Adventure: Battle Tendency
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The year is 1939 and the world is spiraling towards a new conflict. Nations begin to arm themselves as battles ignite, the ambitions of the German Reich plunging Europe and beyond into bloody war. It is those same ambitions that are due to awaken an ancient evil that has been asleep since the early days of the human race. The Nazis, in their search for arcane power to aid their imperial dreams, will uncover an ancient Pillarman in Mexico. This species once preyed on all of humanity and the chain of events started by human greed here will bring back our ancient foes, who wish to become the Ultimate Lifeforms.

boardgame.name: Super Smash Bros. Brawl: The Subspace Emissary
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Smash Brothers, Jumper! This is a world of combat, where video game legends duke it out. Defeat is not the end here, as Fighters are instead transformed into Trophies on a loss. With reduced stakes, battles have become a means of forging bonds and entertainment.

Not all is well. Soon, an antagonist force will lead an assault on this world. This Subspace Army is composed of odd creatures (called Shadow Bugs) and R.O.B.s, with several villainous characters acting as its generals. Its leader, Tabuu, resides in Subspace and desires to pull this world into Subspace in order to rule over it.

You arrive in this world an hour before Mario and Kirby battle at Midair Stadium. You will be staying here for ten years, or until the defeat of Tabuu, whichever comes first.

boardgame.name: Americana Cards
boardgame.description:
A game celebrating the USA during its Bicentennial year. It has 50 state cards, each with the following info:

The state's name.
The capital city of another state (used for game 1). (The first letters of the state and city names's are large, used in games 3 and 5.)
A silhouette of the state, showing its capital, with abbreviations of neighboring states and water bodies around its perimeter.
Three numbers in the range 1-50, showing the state's:
order in joining the US (blue ink)
rank in size, 1 being largest (black ink)
rank in population (as of 1975) (red ink)



There are also 6 wild cards, show different American icons (Old Glory, Statue of Liberty, US Capitol, the Constitution, Liberty Bell, and 1st moon landing), each worth 25 points.

There are rules for five games:

1. State Capitals. Match the listed capital city on the top card on the table with its state card in your hand, or vice versa; otherwise play a card onto the top of the table pile. If you make a match you get all the cards on the table and score their blue numbers.

2. Build the Country. Play any cards from your hand next to table cards they are neighbors to, as shown on their maps, or play any card to the table if you cannot. A successful neighboring play earns you the maximum of the 3 numbers on the card.

3. Match-Em. Play a card so one of the first letters or its state or capital name matches one of the first letters of the top table card; or just play a card onto the top of the table pile. If you match you keep all the current table cards, scoring the numbers next to the words whose initials you matched, and the same spot in all cards under the top card.

4. Hi-Number. Play a card whose blue number is higher than the last card played, or pass. If you play the last card in the current trick you keep the played cards and score the blue number of each of them.

5. Americana. Play one or more cards so that one large initial of each of them adds to a growing word on the table, or just play one card to start a new word. If you complete a valid word you keep its cards and score their blue numbers. Valid words are those about anything about America: a state or city name, famous person, work of art, invention, etc.

For each of these games, you refill your hand after play, and the target score for a win is 1776.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Classic Card Game Compendium
boardgame.description:
Three great card games in one. Take your choice from Pit, the corner the market game; Whot, the fast moving numbers and shapes game; or Lexicon, the classic word game.

You'll have the chance to play all three with the Top Cards Classic Compendium.

[The above adapted from the box bottom]

The rules for the three games are all in a single rules sheet.
The decks of cards have backs not seen in non-Winning Moves editions.

boardgame.name: The Nightshine Mausoleum
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

No eternal rest for the wicked...
Attacks by the undead are on the rise in and near the swamp. Rumr has it that the swamp was once an elvish settlement, lost long ago to ruin and sunken into the marsh. But one structure, at least, has yet to be consumed by the swamp. And a long dead cultist of Orcus, buried in that forgotten mausoleum, has returned from the dead.

Includes

A short adventure for 4-5 characters of 3rd to 4th level
A map of the Nightshine Mausoleum
Stat blocks for all monsters

boardgame.name: Wild West Train Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Board one of our wild west trains for a journey full of pitfalls!

This product allows you to generate the condition of the train, its number of wagons, and its type.

3 types of trains can be created, depending on what they carry: passengers and goods, military or artists. For each type of train, different types of wagons and their content can be generated.

boardgame.name: Into The Echoside: Cupcake
boardgame.description:
A promotional card in the Psychopathic faction for Into The Echoside only obtainable from DCG con. It is a slightly different size and thickness than the other cards, likely requiring sleeves for play.

Costs 5 Karma, Worth 2GP

Effect: +1 Karma & draw a Flavor Card

boardgame.name: Neoclassical Geek Revival Second Edition Acidic Rulebook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Neoclassical Geek Revival (NGR) is a take on classic RPGs to the extent that none of the original mechanics survive. This is the Acidic set of the 2nd Edition rules, as opposed to basic. Look its the advanced rules and I am just having a go at being clever.

boardgame.name: Neoclassical Geek Revival Second Edition Content Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Neoclassical Geek Revival (NGR) is a take on classic RPGs to the extent that none of the original mechanics survive. This is the content guide, a companion to the 2nd edition advanced rules. It contains a career path system, encounter tables, magic items, unique grimoires, and more.

boardgame.name: Iron Helm: The Fanny Pack
boardgame.description:
The Fanny Pack is a booster packs meant to enhance the base game of Iron Helm. You will need a copy of the base game of Iron Helm to enjoy this pack. The Fanny Pack adds new Characters, Trappings, Loot, Enemies, Plots, and more to the base game.

Simply add the cards from this pack to your base game. You can always use the icons at the top of the card to remove this pack at a later time if you ever want to return the base game to its original form, but I doubt you will...

The included Artifact Card requires the expansion Iron Chest to be used.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Ancient Merchant
boardgame.description:
When the silk road was expanded, the trade between different cities was developed. Everyday many merchants started to join this trade to achieve money and fame.
In this game the players are playing in the role of merchants who are competing to achieve the place of the best merchant in the world. So they travel to different places and buy goods by Participating the auction. Then they transfer the goods to other place and sell them to achieve fame and wealth.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ops and Tactics: Handy Armory Manual - Armory
boardgame.description:
User summary:

An equipment book heavily focused on weapons. Includes a wide range of weapons from modern to near-future.

boardgame.name: Annie X
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Annie X was mad as hell, and she wasn’t going to take it anymore. The stage and the dance floor were the only places Annie felt absolutely free. It was one night on stage that Annie locked eyes with an older woman who didn’t look like part of their usual crowd. Annie was intrigued, and after a few drinks Annie learned the woman was their real mother. It wasn’t until the woman gave them a necklace of skulls that Annie realized it was all true. She devoted every waking moment to learning what it meant to be a Scion of Kali. Except Saturdays. Saturday nights are for dancing and punching the shit out of anyone who gets in her space.

Annie X is a new ready-made character for Scion: Hero Second Edition. It is part of the "Storypath Tasty Bits" program, where every month in 2021 Onyx Path offers a small product that ties into one of its Storypath games.

boardgame.name: So Now You're A Hero
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

So Now You’re a Hero provides advice and examples for Storyguides running a session that brings their players’ characters from Origin to Hero level, starting with prompts to consider during character creation and taking the characters through four scenes centered around their Visitations.

This could be run at the end of an Origin-level series, or as the opening of a new Hero-level game. It might even be a vignette you run at the end of your character-creation session to help everyone get to know the members of their soon-to-be Band.

boardgame.name: Where No Adventurer Has Gone Before
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

At the edge of the sea, something lurks, something watches, something waits. It yearns to enter our reality, and its purpose is beyond our comprehension. The adventurers encounter a strange phenomenon at the horizon, where they are affected in ways they don't understand. The mystery behind this event has greater reach than they could have imagined.

boardgame.name: Danger Zone
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In a region outside normal trade routes, a dangerous being condemns the party to be executed for trespassing.

There’s a region of the ocean of roughly 10,000 square miles that has not been greatly explored. When occasionally a ship ventures in, they will either say that their progress was halted for strange reasons, or they are never heard from again. There has been little reason to venture in this open area, as no direct trade routes go through it, and no islands are known to exist within it with any valuable resources. But there are a few reasons a party might be made to venture in. When they do, dangerous adventure awaits.

boardgame.name: The Traveling Salesman
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A small ship has been stolen, and the crew aboard her can’t stay afloat. The party attempts to rescue them, but loses the stolen ship in the process, if not their own ship. They begin to re-turn the thief, a satyr and self-described travel-ing salesman named Henenu Ferghus Loyb, to the authorities. But along the way, he hasn’t given up on his schemes, and his “cargo,” three beautiful women, also are more than they seem.

boardgame.name: The Barovia Gazetteer Collected Edition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Barovia Gazetteers, a set of guidebooks containing detailed setting information, new encounters, and additional resources for running Curse of Strahd, have been published in a collected edition.

boardgame.name: Castle Ravenloft
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Castle Ravenloft, your complete guide to the iconic dungeon. This supplement contains a wealth of information and resources, including:


A guide to roleplaying Strahd von Zarovich, in and out of combat
A new method for lifting the curse of Strahd
Suggestions for exploring the castle as Strahd's guests or his enemies
Mechanics for pulling off the ultimate heist: breaking into Strahd's treasury!
Modified rooms, crypts, and random encounters
Notes on the wedding of Strahd and Ireena
A couple of classic traps rescued from the original I6 Ravenloft module!
A new stat block for Strahd von Zarovich, and new abilities for the Heart of Sorrow
A revised and expanded Tome of Strahd
New epilogues for ending the campaign


User summary:

Intended to supplement Curse of Strahd

boardgame.name: Krezk and the West
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Krezk and the West covers two locations for the price of one, offering comprehensive guides to Krezk and the werewolf den. This guide contains a wealth of information and resources, including:

A quick reference guide to Krezk and its residents
Rewritten events for the Abbot's request and the blessed pool
A major expansion of the Abbey of St. Markovia, including a deadly new menace
A completely rewritten backstory for the Abbot's patients
A new mini-dungeon under the abbey
Optional rules for making werewolves more dangerous and lycanthropy more terrifying
Challenging new rules for removing the curse of lycanthropy
Rules for running the escape from the den as a combined chase and skill challenge
New stat blocks for Clovin Belview, the werewolf pack leader, and a sinister creature that lurks beneath the abbey
What creature? What are you talking about? There's nothing beneath the abbey! Come up and see for yourself...


User summary:

Intended to supplement Curse of Strahd

boardgame.name: The Amber Temple
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Amber Temple covers two locations for the price of one, offering guides to the Tsolenka Pass and the Amber Temple. This gazetteer contains a wealth of background information and resources, including:

A step-by-step guide to every stage of the expedition, from the valley floor to the temple door
A new random encounter table for the mountains, including higher CR encounters
Weather rules and environmental hazards
Guides to the rooms, traps, NPCs, and events in the Amber Temple
A redesigned library with a new combat encounter
New rules for dark gift corruption that make the transformations gradual and terrifying
A new stat block for Sangzor, along with stats for every other creature that has been added to the guide


User summary:

Intended to supplement Curse of Strahd

boardgame.name: The Land of Barovia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This guide contains a wealth of resources for bringing the land of Barovia to life, including:

Expanded map scale and travel tables
Quick reference guides for all three major settlements
Culture and traditions of Barovia, including a calendar
An expanded history of Barovia
A complete breakdown of agriculture in Barovia
Wine names and prices, by the cup or the barrel
A special appendix: The Lives of the Saints of Old Barovia
A DM's guide discussing character generation, leveling, session zero, and more
NEW! All travel rules and encounters now collected in one convenient PDF
NEW! All handouts now available as separate, editable Word files so you can customize them for your game


User summary:

Intended to supplement Curse of Strahd

boardgame.name: The Old Bonegrinder
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This guide contains vital information and resources for running encounters along the Old Svalich Road, including:

Optional rules for travel and guidelines for modifying travel encounters
Four new travel encounters: the Abandoned Farmhouse, Bandits' Lair, Crossroads Feast, and Doomed Caravan
A band of undead highwaymen led by the legendary Red Lukas
Suggestions for balancing the Old Bonegrinder without killing your party
A complete guide to the night hags' deadly nightmare haunting--how the party can avoid it, and how the hags will strike back
A proven method for trapping the night hags using only the materials available in Barovia
A guide to playing that imposing, well-dressed nobleman, Vasili von Holtz


User summary:

Intended to supplement Curse of Strahd

boardgame.name: The Town of Vallaki
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Town of Vallaki is the largest gazetteer yet, containing a wealth of resources for running the largest settlement in Barovia, including:

A quick reference guide
Notes for every location in town
Guides to the neighborhoods of Vallaki
Fifteen new NPCs to populate every corner of town
Battle maps for a much larger St. Andral's Church, complete with map key and crypts
Guides for the special events, including an expanded quest for St. Andral's bones
A new combat encounter on Lake Zarovich
A new take on Victor and Stella
A guide to Lady Wachter's rule and notes for what happens afterwards
An all-out attack by Strahd and his forces
A bonus scenario where the characters track a vampire serial killer
Stat blocks for vampire spawn who have retained some of their class and racial abilities
A new NPC stat block, the warlock of the undead
The thaumaturgical journals of Victor Vallakovich
NEW! All handouts now available as separate, editable Word files so you can customize them for your game


User summary:

Intended to supplement Curse of Strahd

boardgame.name: The Village of Barovia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This guide contains everything you need to start your Curse of Strahd campaign, including:


Notes on the Death House, the Village of Barovia, and the Tser Pool camp
Suggestions for running the Tarokka reading
A character guide for playing Ireena
A new adventure hook, “The People Eater”
A group of rival adventurers to compete with the party
A bonus scenario featuring the siege of the burgomaster’s mansion
Stat blocks for Kolyan Indirovich, Ireena Kolyana, and a warlock NPC
NEW! All handouts now available as separate, editable Word files so you can customize them for your game


User summary:

Intended to supplement Curse of Strahd

boardgame.name: The Wild Lands
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Wild Lands covers four locations from the most remote and dangerous corners of Barovia, offering guides to the Wizard of Wines, Yester Hill, Argynvostholt, and the ruins of Berez. This guide contains a wealth of background information and resources, including:

Suggestions for increasing the challenges at the winery
Ideas for rearranging the encounters at Yester Hill
New corruption mechanics for the Blood Spear of Kavan
A dynamic search and pursuit at Argynvostholt
A new encounter at Berez
Battle tactics for Baba Lysaga
An expanded backstory for Muriel Vinshaw
New stat blocks for the drowned maiden, the forest druid, and the Gulthias tree
A Martikov family bedtime story


User summary:

Intended to supplement Curse of Strahd

boardgame.name: Van Richten's Tower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Van Richten's Tower is a comprehensive campaign guide and expansion covering all things relating to the irascible monster hunter. This guide contains a wealth of background information and resources, including:

Guidelines for running the magical traps
Suggestions for increasing the challenge in the special events
Details of Van Richten's plan to attack the Vistani
Rules for conducting the blood rite to lift van Richten's curse
Strahd's counterattack against van Richten
Specialized equipment for van Richten's monster hunting arsenal
A rewritten journal that reconciles van Richten and Ezmerelda's histories while excising the problematic stereotypes of the Vistani
NEW! All handouts now available as separate, editable Word files so you can customize them for your game


User summary:

Intended to supplement Curse of Strahd

boardgame.name: The Orphans of Vinesnake Hill
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Missing people in a secluded town. Rumors of a cursed forest. Is your group ready to find out what is going on in the village of Vinesnake Hill?

This 5E adventure [is] for players of levels 1-4

boardgame.name: Fantasy and/or Science Fiction Multi Language Dictionary - Languages of Amoverek
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This includes all of the current languages called Common, Elvish, Dwarvish, Fairy, Uncommon, Trollish, Orcish, Goblin, Draconic, & Alien

The dictionary (no grammar) material used in the making of this all-in-one volume and are included in this volume are the following Grammar Fuel titles:


Elvish Language – Created for the Aioskoru World
Fairy Language – Created for the Aioskoru World
Orcish Language – Created for the Aioskoru World
Goblin Language – Created for the Aioskoru World
Dwarvish Language – Created for the Aioskoru World
Trollish Language – Created for the Aioskoru World
Draconic Language – Created for the Aioskoru World
Alien Language – Created for the Aioskoru World
In addition, Common Language – Created for the Aioskoru World.
In addition, Uncommon Language – Created for the Aioskoru World

boardgame.name: Grammar Fuel: Fantasy Genre & Subgenres
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A few purposes and uses of these tables are the following:


Help generate random adventure story scene synopsis based on interpreted results (an example is give for each of the genres rolling for one of each part of speech).
Help generate random dialogue for NPCs based on dialogue styles, keyword results, and interpretation.
Help generate random descriptive nouns for random people, places, things, or ideas.
Help generate random descriptive verbs for random events, states, or actions.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Character Reaction Engine Expanded
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What causes different types of characters to experience different emotions for different reasons? This system considers personality types and meaning in for how they may experiencel instinctual and initial emotions following an event or situation.

Something happens in the story that means 'loss' leads to 'withdraw & slow down' because the character needs to 'heal' and experience 'sadness'

So, this issue is entirely focused on releasing an expanded reaction engine, adding to the related list of definitions, and included the main supporting generator tables.

Why make character reactions more complex or expanded?

The answer depends on the type of game that a player is playing.


For hack-and-slash games where action is a priority, possibly the 12 types of reactions are sufficient.
However, for character-focused games, where character interaction is a priority, having 24 additional reactions helps to bring more and greater meaning into the type of game that a player is playing.


User summary:

A revised and expanded version of Character Reaction Engine

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Character Thinking Engine Expanded
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Why do different types of characters decide or think differently? This issue considers personality types and meaning for how characters may consciously decide analytically and intuitively. It has tools to help judge right from wrong. It also has tools for distracting or sidetracking issues such as irrational biases, fear, disgust, or madness.

User summary:

A revised and expanded version of Character Thinking Engine

boardgame.name: Arcs: Blighted Reach Campaign Expansion
boardgame.description:
By adding the Blighted Reach Campaign Expansion, you can also play Arcs in an innovative micro-campaign, where each game is one episode in an epic trilogy that stretches across an even larger galaxy.

Everyone begins as petty regents in a dying empire, but your fates quickly diverge. The campaign contains twenty-four fate seeds, each with tons of branches, twists, and turns. Uncover lost knowledge, guide your people to a new home, or forge a galactic confederation!

As you complete objectives and make critical decisions, the campaign grows and changes. If you destroy a world, its refugees might flood the galaxy in your next game. If you find your society driven to a state of collapse, you can even abandon your homeworld and play the next game operating out of a lone flagship.

Each game in the campaign takes less than two hours to play. You can sit down for a single skirmish and then pack up for another day, or settle in for an epic three-act saga! Just make sure to stretch and drink some water between games.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Deathly Thrones
boardgame.description:
Deathly Thrones is a print at home solitaire roguelike game using a deck of 52 playing cards and a quest booklet in a "zine" format.

Playing cards are used in an original way.
The 1 to 9 ♡ and ♤ cards are the Health and Armor counters.
The 1 to 9 ♧ and ♢ cards are the Battle cards.
The rest of the cards, the 10 to King of all colors, are the Steps cards.

Each turn the player follow 3 phases:

Draw a step cards: Then, read the quest to move your character to this event.
Apply the event: Take a nap, fall in a trap, fight monsters, etc
Check: If the player manage to succeed the event, they start over from phase [1]. If they didn't, they lose. If they beat the boss at the 40th step, they won!


It take less than one minute to setup and each game takes 10-20 minutes. The rules are simple, you choose your hero, note your health and armor, and then select a quest 'zine to conquer a new throne!

Game published in 'Print&Play' format and delivery in two versions: A zine one containing the pages for all the quests that it can be fold into booklets ; A standalone one, that they can reference on digital devices or print for a non-folding reference sheet.

—description from the desiger

boardgame.name: Fox Hunt
boardgame.description:
It looks like a movie but don't just sit there

Shot in 16mm, it's got the look and feel of a feature film. The sweeping plot and the complex characters. Dueling Elvises and a bad guy in mittens.

And its got you, Jack Fremont--TV trivia geek with an empty fridge, now regular-guy-turned-spy. Because here's the offer: a chance to save the world . . . and enough money to pay the rent.

Your days of just watching the screen are over, Jack. You've got to observe. Think. Decide. Act. And watch your back--every moment, every move.

You've got 24 hours to find the Fox . . . get free of Frank . . . blow the whistle on the CIA . . . blow the cover off the Russian mob . . . snatch the cash . . . get the girl . . . and return the tux.

How it all ends--and there are 10 possibilities--is entirely up to you.

So you see, it's not just your movie--it's your move.

- from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Pawclaw Mini Expansion
boardgame.description:
This mini expansion can be added to Iron Forest and ICECOOL/ICECOOL2. It comes with 1 flickable miniature and 7 honey barrel tokens.

This mechanical bear is crazy for honey! This mini expansion essentially gives you an extra turn, but with the Pawclaw miniature.

In Iron Forest this mini expansion can be added to any scenario. The team that has most honey tokens acquired at the end of their turn, gets to use the Pawclaw miniature to help achieve their scenario goal.

In ICECOOL each player collects honey barrel tokens, which can be exchanged for an extra turn with Pawclaw to help you get the fish or catch the rascals.

boardgame.name: The Emperor Mini Expansion
boardgame.description:
This mini expansion can be added to Iron Forest and ICECOOL/ICECOOL2. This expansion comes with 1 flickable miniature and 6 snowflake tokens.

In Iron Forest this mini expansion can be added to any scenario. The Emperor is trying to freeze both teams' mechas. If a team's all mechas are frozen, they lose the scenario.

In ICECOOL "The Emperor" lets you mess with other players or help yourself. By collecting snowflake tokens, you can move fish onto any other door or exchange your fish cards with new ones from the deck.

boardgame.name: Guldgraver-spillet
boardgame.description:
The players are inhabitants of Poor City, trying to accumulate $500 by working in the city or by digging for gold.
On your turn, you'll roll the white die (if you have a horse, you'll also roll the black die and use the sum for movement). On a roll of 1 (on the white die), you can move the Indian 1-6 spaces instead - if he lands on a space with a player piece, the player discards his gold. On a roll of 6 (on the white die), you'll draw an event card from either the city or countryside stack. If you land on a space with a gold nugget token, you take it and bring it back to the bank to convert it into gold. You can ordinarily only carry one gold nugget token.
Earning money in the city is also possible.

boardgame.name: Game Wizards: The Epic Battle for Dungeons & Dragons
boardgame.description:
From publisher:

Summary
The story of the arcane table-top game that became a pop culture phenomenon and the long-running legal battle waged by its cocreators.

When Dungeons & Dragons was first released to a small hobby community, it hardly seemed destined for mainstream success—and yet this arcane tabletop role-playing game became an unlikely pop culture phenomenon. In Game Wizards, Jon Peterson chronicles the rise of Dungeons & Dragons from hobbyist pastime to mass-market sensation, from the initial collaboration to the later feud of its creators, Gary Gygax and Dave Arneson. As the game's fiftieth anniversary approaches, Peterson—a noted authority on role-playing games—explains how D&D and its creators navigated their successes, setbacks, and controversies.

Peterson describes Gygax and Arneson's first meeting and their work toward the 1974 release of the game; the founding of TSR and its growth as a company; and Arneson's acrimonious departure and subsequent challenges to TSR. He recounts the “Satanic Panic” accusations that D&D was sacrilegious and dangerous, and how they made the game famous. And he chronicles TSR's reckless expansion and near-fatal corporate infighting, which culminated with the company in debt and overextended and the end of Gygax's losing battle to retain control over TSR and D&D.

With Game Wizards, Peterson restores historical particulars long obscured by competing narratives spun by the one-time partners. That record amply demonstrates how the turbulent experience of creating something as momentous as Dungeons & Dragons can make people remember things a bit differently from the way they actually happened.

boardgame.name: Solo Hockey
boardgame.description: Solo Hockey is a “ROLL THE DICE AND SEE WHAT HAPPENED” type sport game for 1-2 players. The game is designed to provide excitement and realistic statistics while maintaining as much playability as possible. Only main game events affecting the outcome are recreated.

boardgame.name: Vademécum de Ablaneda
boardgame.description:
(From the back of the book):

Es bueno volver a echarse la capa al hombro, llenar la alforja con vituallas y salir a explorar los terribles caminos del Condado de Ablaneda.

Vademécum de Ablaneda, que, como su nombre indica, será compañero indispensable al recorrer los derroteros, vericuetos, cañadas, trochas y veredas que no solo abundan en el camino de los dispuestos ronderos, sino también en la labor de director de juego. De la mano de este libro, tendréis material de sobra para atajar la a veces enojosa preparación de aventuras. En él se compila material que ya se podía hallar en formato digital:

· Gentes de Ablaneda, que detalla los personajes no jugadores más relevantes del Condado, en sus distintas facetas.
· Milagros de Ablaneda, veinticinco semillas inspiradas en la literatura clásica española.
· Bestias de Ablaneda, que aumenta en mucho el bestiario de seres y bestias inspirados en la mitología de nuestra península.
· Y Lances de Ablaneda, una recopilación de tres aventuras con las que poner a prueba el acero de la Ronda, a la que se añaden tres nuevas aventuras jamás llevadas a la imprenta, engendradas como una segunda parte de Lances de Ablaneda.

Creedme si os digo que, con este tomo, jamás os pillará por sorpresa el sonar del cuerno, el entrecochar de las armas y el grito de “la ronda o la horca”, pues os será fiel herramienta en el aplacamiento de vuestros jugadores.

boardgame.name: Ben 10: Power Trip
boardgame.description:
Ben and his family are enjoying their European vacation... Until evil Magician hex unleashes the power of four mysterious crystals! Only Ben 10 can break the Curse - so get ready to transform into powerful aliens to battle enemies, solve puzzles and freely explore an exciting 3D world. It's hero time!

with Gwen and Grandpa Max on your side, all the humour and rivalry from the Cartoon Network show is here. And since four arms are better than two, Kevin Levin is along for the adventure in local split-screen co-op. This is one power trip you'll want to take again and again.

it's hero time!

boardgame.name: Ysystem
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ysystem es un reglamento genérico diseñado para disfrutar de cualquier aventura de rol en casi cualquier ambientación que puedas imaginar. Como sistema de juego destaca por ser completo, sencillo, sólido, rápido, heroico, ligeramente táctico y con un cierto componente narrativo. Se trata de una versión madura y bastante modificada del reglamento nativo del juego de rol IMSERSO to the limit, con el que guarda ciertas semejanzas (las suficientes, por lo menos, como para percibir ese parentesco y hacerse una idea general de su lógica). Con Ysystem puedes disfrutar plenamente de cualquier setting sin necesidad de aprender nuevas mecánicas cada vez. El reglamento es gratuito y está disponible en libre descarga para cualquier aficionado, autor o editorial que lo quiera implementar gracias a su OGL. ¡Compartir es vivir!

boardgame.name: Última Función
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Última función es una aventura de terror ambientada en el páramo de Ciudad Real. El profesor Antonio Jiménez, especializado en la investigación histórica y las leyendas manchegas, requiere la ayuda urgente de los personajes, que llegan a la localidad de Villafranca de San Juan entre grandes lluvias. Ese diluvio que cae del cielo es solo el prólogo de una espantosa experiencia en el Hotel-Venta Sancho Panza, un establecimiento situado en lo alto del cerro de San Lucio en el que el pasado vuelve por sus fueros como instrumento de la venganza, el rencor y la locura más absoluta.

La aventura proporciona cuatro PJ pregenerados dotados de trasfondo listos para entrar en acción, aunque para jugarla necesitas contar con el reglamento genérico Ysystem. Ysystem es un sistema de reglas completo, sencillo, versátil, sólido, heroico, ligeramente táctico y con un cierto componente narrativo. Con Ysystem puedes disfrutar plenamente de cualquier ambientación sin necesidad de aprender nuevas mecánicas cada vez.

boardgame.name: Lab Notes
boardgame.description:
Class is now in session for Lab Notes! This roll-and-write game features the brain teaser challenge of putting together chemical bonds. Each round, a player rolls all the elemental dice for Hydrogen, Oxygen, Nitrogen, Carbon, or a useful but dangerous Bunsen Burner. The rolling player chooses their element first, leaving the rest of the table to scratch their heads to fit the remainder within their lab notes.

Elements now in hand, the players choose where to keep their elements. They can notate in the research field or trash them for some added benefits, later. Combine elements based on the real rules of chemistry! Double and triple bonds are worth more, but you can only bond with elements near each other and as they’re written.

Don’t worry if you’re not sure about what bonds work where. There are handy-dandy notecards outlining real, actual chemicals you can make! Manage to make the chemical on the card? You get a bonus!

Lab fires burn a slot within your lab notes, but maybe that will work out for you, who knows!
The game ends when the first person fills up their sheet. Tally up all those points and see who’s top of the class!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Bloodied & Bruised Vol. 3: Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes
Bloodied & Bruised: Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Combat Actions for the Creatures in Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes

The bugbear chief nurses a gushing wound in her side before issuing an order of retreat to her allies. A bright light forms around the angel’s dying body, blinding everyone near it as it passes on from the world of the living. With blood streaming down its torso, an enraged hill giant slams its fists into the ground and causes the earth around it to quake.

Bloodied & Bruised is a series providing new combat actions for the creatures in the 5e roster. When pushed to their limits in combat, these monsters, critters, fiends, and foes gain new abilities that aid them in battle, or perhaps spell their doom depending on the circumstances. Bloodied & Bruised takes inspiration from the "bloodied" condition from 4e, making entirely new combat actions that can completely change the nature of a fight.

In addition, Bloodied & Bruised also introduces several "death throes" to the game, marking the demise of certain creatures with a grand explosion, heavy fall, or other unique effect to make the slaying of a great monster a truly unique experience.

boardgame.name: Slayers Almanac
boardgame.description:
‘’From Inside of Book”
The Slayers Almanac is a setting supplement for the Slayers roleplaying game (RPG). Inside, you’ll find a collection of diverse and dangerous districts for your monster hunters to explore. This book was written as a collaborative effort of over 10 authors, each bringing you their own unique take on what The City has in store for you.

While the cover of this book says Slayers Almanac, the city settings inside this book can be used for any system. There aren’t any mechanical rules written for the districts themselves, instead they are packed with flavor that can be used with any system.

Slayers may be the backdrop of the districts, but feel free to plop them down into another campaign you’re running the next time you need to introduce your players to a truly unique urban environment.

boardgame.name: Monster Weaknesses
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

MONSTER WEAKNESSES FOR EVERY MONSTER MANUAL CREATURE

500+ Combat and Social Weaknesses. This book provides combat weaknesses for every monster in the Monster Manual and social weaknesses for every monster that speaks a language available to player characters. The inspiration for these weaknesses comes from a creature’s anatomy, description in the Monster Manual, or well-known legends. Each weakness presented in this book is meant to be a trait that can be appended to a creature’s stat block.

14 Custom Illustrated Experts. This book contains characters knowledgeable in each of the different monster types to walk you through these monster weaknesses. These characters can be used in a campaign as NPCs or potentially be the authors of tomes or notes found in a library.

Advice and Mechanics. This book contains advice and mechanics for discovering monster weaknesses as well as designing your own!

boardgame.name: Future Classics Collection
boardgame.description:
Redefining Fun . . . and Games.

Phenomenal graphics, extraordinary sound effects, and gripping interactive play from LIVE Studios, Inc.

DISKMAN
Computer viruses, magnets and bombshells challenge you at every turn! Can you back up your disks before all is lost?

BLOCKALANCHE
The ultimate test of nerves and skill. One false move and your hopes for winning shatter like class!

LOST 'N MAZE
Towering, impenetrable walls, a wealth of treasures and obstacles--but it only LOOKS impossible!

DIET RIOT
A nightmare of gargantuan proportions: can you skinny your way through tempting treats and monstrous morsels?

TANKBATTLE
A classic battle of blitz: steer clear of blasts, keep missiles in stock, avoid obstacles, and capture the enemy's coat of arms!

With some games, LIVE Studios' exciting "Three Ways to Play" allows owners to enjoy full screen play for the single contender; an innovative split-screen method when using dual joy sticks for simultaneous head-to-head competition; or, with split screen again, the chance to go one-on-one with a dynamic computer personality!

- from the back of the box

boardgame.name: X-Ceter-O x X
boardgame.description: This game is a mash up between X-ceter-O and Tic Tac Toe times ten; it's played on a grid of nine Tic Tac Toes (like Tic Tac Toe times Ten) and requires winning three games of Tic Tac Toe in a row, but using the rules of X-ceter-O on each of the Tic Tac Toe fields.

boardgame.name: Zeus! We Just Wanna Talk!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Zeus! We Just Wanna Talk! is a lighthearted scenario providing an inciting event to bring Hero-level Scions together into a Band. It can kick off a chronicle or simply be a fun one-shot. Existing Bands can also enjoy the scenario with minor modifications.

Just like “we just wanna talk” can change meaning depending on how it’s said, this adventure’s goal can shift depending on what tack the characters choose, from a dark tale of vengeance to a slapstick comedy to an earnest attempt to talk Zeus into mending his ways. Regardless of what the Scions aim to do, they’ll have their work cut out for them. Zeus didn’t survive thousands of years with as many enemies as he has through luck alone.

Over the course of the scenario, the characters meet each other as strangers in an escape room. When the activity becomes deadly serious, they learn that they’re all Scions, with at least one common foe. They track down Hera, who provides them the means and opportunity to confront Zeus in a bar. The Scions sneak into the bar and come face to face with the Sky Father, forever changing their fates.

boardgame.name: Trail of the Apprentice Character and Creature Cards
boardgame.description:
On the Trail of Adventure!

The Trail of the Aprentice Character and Creature Cards are a handy accessory for the 5-part Trail of the Apprentice adventure saga, featuring 52 characters and creatures from beginning to end, including adversaries like orc bandits and kobold rogues to hell hounds, hags, elementals, and even Kezzerex the black dragon, alongside an assortment of allies and associates, plus the seven sample iconic characters from the adventure compilation. Every card has a full-color illustration on one side and nearly all provide complete stats for the character or creature on the reverse.

Trail of the Apprentice is a five-part campaign for 1st- through 5th-level characters, using the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game rules. Designed to provide a series of exciting adventures suitable for all ages, especially new and younger players, these cards will help bring the lands and people of Terrallien to life for your players. Bring home this amazing adventure saga and make your next family game night Legendary

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: They Came From Plan 9! Characters and Story Hooks
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Greetings, my friend. We are all interested in the future, for that is where you and I are going to spend the rest of our lives. And remember, my friend, future events such as these will affect you in the future. You are interested in the unknown, the mysterious, the unexplainable. That is why you are here. And now, for the first time, we are bringing to you the full story of what happened on that fateful day. We are bringing you all the evidence, based only on the secret testimony of the miserable souls who survived this terrifying ordeal. The incidents, the places. My friend, we cannot keep this a secret any longer. Let us punish the guilty. Let us reward the innocent. My friend, can your heart stand the shocking facts about grave robbers from outer space?

They Came from Plan 9! is a micro sourcebook for They Came from Beneath the Sea!, allowing you to play the characters from cult B-movie favorite, Plan 9 from Outer Space!

The horrors and wonders you’ll find in this supplement provide you with the full character sheets and even story hooks for Directors to use in their games, allowing you to tell stories within the movie, and expand plots laid down in this Ed Wood “classic,” perhaps even discovering the horrifying Plan 10 in the process!
boardgame.rpg: They Came From Beneath the Sea!

boardgame.name: Les Fantômes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Eight years ago, the organization known as Les Fantômes (the Ghosts) exploded onto the crime scene with one of the largest heists and ransoming events the world had seen in decades.

Claiming responsibility for first stealing, then ransoming, the Du Martin family diamonds, the organization was set to gain millions from the family. When the news broke that the Du Martin family had been engaged in insider trading, embezzlement, and stock fraud within family-owned businesses, Les Fantômes claimed ownership over leaking the information.

Since that time, Les Fantômes has become synonymous with high-profile theft and people at the top of government watch lists. They are not quiet about their ongoings, and one would believe at times they wish to get caught. Despite that, no one seems to know where Les Fantômes will strike next, or who is involved in the organization.

Now you can portray one of these enigmatic thieves-with-a-heart-of-gold in Trinity Continuum. This PDF expands on the material presented in the Trinity Continuum Core Rulebook, including new Edges and Gifts, as well as rules to help Storyguides manage and organize heists.

boardgame.name: Trinity Continuum: New Lives
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Paths included in the Trinity Continuum Core Rulebook provide a solid foundation from which to create a character.
However, the list is by no means exhaustive. Here, we provide new Origin and Role Paths to expand the options available for character creation, as well as a variety of new Skill Tricks.

These Paths and Skill Tricks are designed for use with the Trinity Continuum Core Rulebook but are suitable for characters in any era.

boardgame.name: Companions Companion: 22nd-Century Pets
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humanity may be spread across the stars, but that hasn’t changed our love of pets. The close association between humans and animals is nothing new and keeping animals for companionship, labor, health, and entertainment is still popular. In Companions Companion, we give you everything you need to add pets to your game of Trinity Continuum: Aeon, including:

Information on natural and gengineered pets, as well as robots and biotech manufactured pets
Creating pets as characters
Stats for 19 different pets
New Edges and Anomay powers

boardgame.name: The Earth Orbital Habitat
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As the station nears completion, and several modules have been finished and are in the process of being fully staffed, the Earth Orbital Habitat is now humanity’s largest space station. Once finished, it will be home to humanity’s largest space-based telescope, the first orbital hotel, facilities for testing manufacturing in space, representatives from more than a dozen national governments and international organizations like Project Utopia, and a space dock capable of constructing ships able to visit any part of the solar system.

Earth Orbital Habitat offers more material for space-faring Trinity Continuum: Aberrant chronicles. Within you will find details of the habitat itself, a look into the politics and intrigue of the Earth Orbital Council, new technology, and writeups of key characters.

boardgame.name: Polyphemus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Polyphemus is a secret cooperative project tasked with investing the strange flux events buried in the secret pockets of our world. These strangely out-of-time investigators step out of the shadows to join with the other Allegiances of the Trinity Continuum.

This new Allegiance is designed for use with the Trinity Continuum Core Rulebook.

boardgame.name: The Kaltrend Iceberg
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A monstrous iceberg slowly drifts on the ocean currents from its home in the frigid Northlands. Imprisoned within, a horrific terror awaits! Will you be brave enough to uncover its hidden secrets?

The Kaltrend Iceberg is a drop in mini-dungeon designed for ocean, coastal, or arctic adventure. It is designed for lower level Players and is compatible with any of your favourite RPGs!

boardgame.name: SIXGEMS
boardgame.description:
In SIXGEMS, players play gem cards to a tableau in front of them in order to manipulate dice around a central area. The gem cards show die faces that affect which dice can be moved, and if their face is adjusted.

The players then have the option to play an account settlement card which may grant certain bonuses, but also triggers a scoring where players earn points for the gems they hold corresponding to the location and face of the blue dice, and lose points in the same manner for the red die.

After a certain number of account settlements have been triggered, the game ends and the person with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Sniper Elite 5
boardgame.description:
The latest instalment in the award-winning series, Sniper Elite 5 offers unparalleled sniping, tactical third-person combat and an enhanced kill cam. Fight your way across the most immersive maps yet, with many real-world locations captured in stunning detail, and an improved traversal system that lets you explore more of them than ever before.

France, 1944 – As part of a covert US Rangers operation to weaken the Atlantikwall fortifications along the coast of Brittany, elite marksman Karl Fairburne makes contact with the French Resistance. Soon they uncover a secret Nazi project that threatens to end the war before the Allies can even invade Europe: Operation Kraken.

Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.videogameversion: Windows | Xbox One | Xbox Series downloadable edition

boardgame.name: Treacherous Trails
boardgame.description:
In Treacherous Trails, the players begin as pioneers in the American Mid-West, and must take the money they start with and decide how to use it as they travel across the West, to their destination on the Pacific coast.

Should they buy a wagon and mule team, or use oxen? Go light and ride on horseback with a pack mule? And what provisions to pack; should they carry a lot of food or hope to hunt and forage along the way? And what kind of gear? Should they spend all the money or save some for the destination? Not knowing what they will encounter on the trail, they must use their best judgement, and no matter how often the game is played, the cards (including random events) will change and the results will vary, even if the same choices are made at the outset. The replayability is high, in this family-friendly, yet competitive game of the American West.

There are 5 trail choices you may take, or you can play as an outlaw along a trail, and once their trails & equipment have been chosen, the game begins. Players vie to reach their cities and then select a career and amass wealth, as they establish themselves on the West coast!

boardgame.name: Thieves of Dorantia
boardgame.description:
No Loyalty Among Thieves!

After being hired by the thieves guild to seek out and eliminate one of their very own, your adventurers play a dangerous game of cat and mouse that turns into a whodunit, on the streets of Dorantia!

Thieves of Dorantia is a high-stakes hex-crawl adventure, featuring:

Rules for new weapon type - pole weapons.
Rules for new dungeon tile type - narrow corridor.
Three new classes - street enforcer, street mage, and scout.
Hex-crawl chase game with gather information mechanic,
city guard, incarceration, twelve city locations and citizens.
City tunnel system with forgotten passageways.
New spells, traps, magic items, and treasure.
Nine unique Final Boss fights.

Requires Four Against Darkness

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Labyrinth Lord Aventuras Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Épicas aventuras esperan a los héroes más audaces.
